dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOUND: Someone breathing, GASPING for breath they're so afraid. And the HIGH-PITCHED WHINE of RAMJETS laboring against heavy side-winds as we struggle to focus on - - OPEN OCEAN. CHURNING, whipping past at a couple hundred miles an hour, 800 feet below a SOLDIER'S DANGLING BOOTS.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What am I doing here? PVT. BILLY CAGE is maybe 20. Too young for this. COLD SWE trickles into his eyes. When he tries to wipe it away, hi ARMORED FINGERS CLACK against clear ACRYLIC. His FACEPLAT Cage is wearing an EXOJACKET: powered, tight-fitting body armor, bristling with weaponry. TWO DOZEN OTHER young, terrified SOLDIERS hang with him, also jacketed, dangling over the OPEN BAY DOORS, over OCEAN. Cage taps a button. His faceplate opens, NOISE floods in DEAFENING ROAR. He rubs his eyes -

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Don't poke yer eye out, bud. PVT. YONABURU, a hard-ass fuckup with Asian features but Southern drawl - Cage's battle-buddy - smiles.

dialogues.speaker: GET YOUR PLATE SHUT, PRIVATE
dialogues.text: FROM UP FRONT, BATTLE-SCARRED SGT. FARELL shoots them a l ACROSS from Cage, GRIFF, 25, a burly-looking bad-ass, kee making an about-to-vomit face, barely fighting back the u

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: PRIVATE GRIFF! Don't PUKE.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFF
dialogues.text: Yes sir! Griff's face twitches again. A female soldier, NANCE, gri

dialogues.speaker: NANCE
dialogues.text: You spit up in yer jacket, you're in for a world a' shit. FORD, a jarhead dickweed proper, LAUGHS, missing a few te Now OIL from Cage's jacketed fingers streaks his face. Th faceplate sucks shut. FLOATING HEADS-UP READOUTS flicker

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You OK there, buddy?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: (trembling) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: We're gonna be fine. I got us life insurance. Mrs. Smith. Yonaburu taps "MRS. SMITH", an antiquated SMITH & WESSON -357, against his faceplate and slips it in his exojacket utility belt. Cage doesn't look too reassured.

dialogues.speaker: BENEATH THEIR FEET
dialogues.text: DOZENS OF OTHER FB90 DROPSHIPS streak by; squarish, clums looking, like flying bricks, which is what everyone calls them. ARTILLERY FIRE STRAFES back and forth as - A DROPSHIP takes a HIT and is gone. FAR BELOW, a BEACH co into view, a red SQUARE superimposed on the HEADS-UP - THE DROP POINT. Cage shuts his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Oh God oh God oh God -

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: GO! GO! Go! The first SOLDIER hits a release and FALLS, tumbling. The ANOTHER. Then ANOTHER. YONABURU gives Cage the thumbs up

dialogues.speaker: WOOOHOOOO
dialogues.text: Yonaburu hits his RELEASE and -

dialogues.speaker: FROM BENEATH THE DROPSHIP
dialogues.text: - SOLDIERS LITTER OUT, tumbling like living ordinance. Yo think parachutes might open... but they don't.

dialogues.speaker: DROP
dialogues.text: CAGE CAN'T DO IT. SEVERAL OTHERS can't, either. ONE SOLD DANGLES by a jacketed hand like a kitten going to the vet Sgt. Farell KICKS the hand free and JUMPS himself -

dialogues.speaker: RADIO
dialogues.text: (screeching) ..-TAKING FIRE UP HERE, WE GOTTA... KERWHAM! The dropship is STRUCK - TWICE. One of the hangi soldiers is TORN IN HALF, the pieces flying. FLAME belche through the DROPBAY and the ship LURCHES - Cage SCREAMS, HITS his release and -

dialogues.speaker: TUMBLES OUT OF THE DROPSHIP
dialogues.text: The dropship ABOVE, in FLAMES, BURNING SOLDIERS falling, OTHERS clinging on as it SPINS OUT OF CONTROL. CAGE FALLS SCREAMING, his HEADS-UP flashing red, the ground RUSHING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - WHUMP! THUMP! FHUMP! SOLDIERS hit the beach, hard enoug leave CRATERS in the WET SAND. AND HERE COMES CAGE, SCREAMING, FLAILING, KICKING - at th last second his jacket goes into AUTOLAND; tiny JETS cush the fall just enough to not break any bones and... WHAM! Two seconds of ear-ringing silence. A GASP as Cage's lung refill, he staggers up, WET SAND falling from his facepla his HEADS-UP highlighting TERRAIN and FRIENDLIES - THREE OTHER SOLDIERS stagger up out of their own craters.

dialogues.speaker: WE MADE IT
dialogues.text: THE HAPPY SOLDIER smiles at Cage, and -— 12 TONS OF FLAMING DROPSHIP LAND ON THE HAPPY SOLDIER. Ca is THROWN BACK from the impact, landing in two feet of su Struggling back up, he sees - THE BROKEN DROPSHIP SPEWING FLAME, ANOTHER SOLDIER stuck under the ship, FLAILING as he dies. Cage stares in shock

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I, uh, yeah - the ship, the ship...

dialogues.speaker: COME ON
dialogues.text: Cage turns, seeing YONABURU with a FLOATING BLUE HEADS-UP FLAG superimposed above him. Cage blindly runs after him

dialogues.speaker: UP THE BEACH
dialogues.text: TENS OF THOUSANDS OF OTHER JACKETED INFANTRY stream to th meetpoints, thick as ants, ARTILLERY STRAFING PAST THEM a

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SKY
dialogues.text: MORE DROPSHIPS THAN WE CAN COUNT and fast-moving STRIKEJE beyond them STREAK in loose formations into the horizon a

dialogues.speaker: OUT TO SEA
dialogues.text: MASSIVE CARRIERS lob HEAVY ORDINANCE into the already bla coastline, pieces of SEA-CLIFF exploding. HALF A MILLION SOLDIERS are landing today in what can only be - HUMANITY'S LAST, BEST STAND... RUBY TUESDAY. It looks like D-Day meets Armageddon.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE AND YONABURU CLUMSILY RUN
dialogues.text: to join their company. It's hard to even walk in an exoja if you're not practiced in it, and they aren't. ON THEIR HEADS-UPS: Their TWO BLUE DOTS get closer to the cluster of OTHER BLUE DOTS as the first ENEMY FIRE starts streaking in, TEARING UP THE BEACH. THAP! THAP! CAGE JUMPS, YONABURU TOO -— - BOTH land badly, SCRAMBLE UP, catching a first GLIMPSE THOUSANDS OF ENEMY INFANTRY streaming down the cliffs but

dialogues.speaker: CAGE AND YONABURU TUMBLE INTO THE TRENCH
dialogues.text: Falling in with the other terrified SOLDIERS, SGT. FARELL screaming to TAC-COM about where's his fucking air suppor Cage has two seconds to get his bearings before -

dialogues.speaker: ON CAGE'S HEADS-UP
dialogues.text: A RED DOT approaching the BLUE DOTS of his company. Then few more RED DOTS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't how it's supposed to be. This isn't... First Division was supposed to clean this up -

dialogues.speaker: LOCK AND LOAD
dialogues.text: Cage watches in mounting horror as the heads-up shows FOU MORE PAIR. And then 20. And then... a WALL OF RED.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: We're all gonna die.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up!

dialogues.speaker: HOLD... HOLDING...
dialogues.text: Even the Sergeant can't hide his fear.

dialogues.speaker: LIGHT 'EM UP
dialogues.text: As the FIRST SOLDIER out of the trench jumps up, a PROJEC hits him, knocking him at CAGE'S FEET -— The PROJECTILE in the soldier's chest isn't of human orig It's streaked with silver, biomechanical, WRIGGLING. A MI "JAVELIN". And from where the thing flew - THE ON-RUSHING MIMIC HORDE. At first, you could mistake them for human infantry, but they're not. They are ALIEN KILLING MACHINES. They're ARMORED, SHARP, and BRISTLING with unidentifiable weaponry that seems to grow out of their bodies, like a nightmare version of the jacketed soldiers they're evolve kill. Parts are METAL, parts GLISTENING BIOMASS. MIMICS have no individuality, no emotion, purpose or existence other than the vicious removal of human life.

dialogues.speaker: INCOMING
dialogues.text: THE SOLDIERS FIRE into the RACING MASS. They might as wel firing BB-GUNS at an oncoming BUFFALO STAMPEDE. ANOTHER soldier, down the line, takes TWO JAVELIN HITS. H jacket starts SHAKING, JITTERBUGGING off his brainstem's death-throes, his autocannon FIRING wildly - MIMIC JAVELINS sweep the trench where Cage and Yonaburu to aim - THUP THUP THUP!

dialogues.speaker: CHECKPOINT TWO
dialogues.text: Soldiers start RUNNING. But Cage is FROZEN TO THE SPOT, trembling, unable to MOVE. Yonaburu SLIDES DOWN BESIDE HI

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: COME ON, CAGE! WE GOTTA -— - BLAM! A SECTION OF TRENCH COLLAPSES. The hail of sand and smoke clears just in time to see the rest of 3rd Platoon HAULING ASS UP THE BEACH. ON CAGE'S H UP, the LITTLE BLUE DOTS of their team head OFFSCREEN. CAGE AND YONABURU ARE TOTALLY CUT OFF.

dialogues.speaker: SHIT
dialogues.text: Yonaburu slides into firing position - target numbering systems on OVERLOAD -

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus, here it comes. Cage lifts his weapon, shaking, trying to pick a target. useless. In two seconds, they're gonna be DEAD MEAT.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Oh god oh god oh god - A squelchy RADIO SCREECH -

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF BREEDER, (RADIO)
dialogues.text: ...VALKYRIE ONE, this is CHIEF BREEDER. STRIKEJETS GOT A LOCK...

dialogues.speaker: YES, MA'AM
dialogues.text: SLEEK U.D.F. STRIKEJETS, FOUR OF THEM, streak in low. MIM volley JAVELIN as the sleek aircraft swing in for bombing ONE STRIKEJET takes a hit and tumbles, FLAMING, the PILOT SCREAMING as he spins, PLOWING INTO the MIMIC FRONT LINE. .-. but then the OTHER STRIKEJETS deliver their payloads. KATHOOM! A WALL OF FLAME goes up, the ground SHAKING fro impact. SMOKING, TWITCHING FRAGMENTS of MIMIC RAIN DOWN -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! WHAM! WHAM! THREE BIG, JACKETED SOLDIERS land, SMOO ROLLING into 3-point fighting position. This is DOG COMPA DOG COMPANY SOLDIERS are different. Their exojackets are blackened, dented, tricked out with graffiti, decals from countries they've fought in. Their grim faces are scarred Not a one of them stands under 6'4".

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN'S VOICE, (RADIO)
dialogues.text: Eat ‘em up, boys. The Dogs' MASSIVE SHOULDER ROCKETS OPEN FIRE, 20mm, 50mm cannons nailing MIMICS right and left -

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Holy shit! CAGE'S EYES GO WIDE and the WORLD GOES SLOW as -

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT-MAJOR RITA VRATASKI
dialogues.text: AKA "VALKYRIE ONE", AKA "THE FULL METAL BITCH", LEAPS, fl

dialogues.speaker: RIGHT OVER CAGE AND YONABURU'S HEADS -
dialogues.text: Her sleek exojacket is painted BLOOD RED. It's bare of weaponry except for - her TUNGSTEN CARBIDE BATTLE AXE. Al comically HUGE, nearly as big and certainly as heavy as s is. Good for one thing: BISECTING MIMICS. The axe SWINGS and four MIMICS are converted to eight TWITCHING HEAPS. She rolls into a PERFECT BATTLE STANCE. Her face; beautiful, battle-ready, and deadly calm -

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Take me to your leader. - and with a collective YELL, the rest of DOG COMPANY fol her STRAIGHT INTO THE MIMIC FRONT LINE. Yonaburu JUMPS UP

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: It's RITA! THE FULL METAL BITCH! Come on, man, we gotta - But Cage is running across the sand. DESERTING.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Worse yet, TWO MIMIC RUNNERS have detached and GIVE CHAS YONABURU FIRES, taking one down, but the other is closing He looks back, to where RITA and the DOGS mercilessly eng the mimic in a ballet of precision fighting. He'd join, b

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck. Yonaburu takes off after Cage as - - Cage BLINDLY HAULS ASS for the SEA CLIFFS, scrambling u rocky bluff. Yonaburu catches up -

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have to get back to the unit! - and GRABS Cage's leg. Cage KICKS, FLAILING -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: We won't make it! They're all DEAD!

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: They shoot deserters!

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I don't care! LET ME GO! Cage CRAWLS, DRAGGING YONABURU to the CREST OF THE CLIFF.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, I'M NOT LETTING YOU -
dialogues.text: Yonaburu stands, HEAVING BACK on CAGE'S LEG, and -— SHUP! HALF OF YONABURU'S head disappears in a shattering red, the broken shell of his faceplate smoking.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Yonaburu's jacket twitches, shudders, goes limp - and fal

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Cage tries to stand, but Yonaburu's hand is still grippin his ankle. He twists, scrambling up - CAGE SEES WHAT SHOT YONABURU. The cliff's crest is a NEST OF MIMIC SCOUTS. SEVEN of the Only a little less surprised than Cage. Before he knows what he's doing, he's got TARGET-LOCK. C FIRES BLINDLY, the shock of his forearm cannon SPINNING h around in an arc - TAKTAKTAKTAKTAK! SEVERAL MIMICS GO DOWN, Cage FALLS on hi ASS, just missing the swings of BLADED MIMIC ARMS - - and he's STILL FIRING, into MIMIC LEGS, WHIPPING them d to the ground. No one has ever fought worse - or been as lucky - as Cage at this moment. In 2.3 seconds, SIX DEAD MIMIC lie twitching around him. Cage SCOOTS back, seeing - THE LAST MIMIC on the rise, getting ready to FIRE. He SHOOTS it. But with a CHITTERING, BUZZING NOISE, a FRE BIRTHED JAVELIN erupts from its dying body like a 400 mph tumor and HITS Cage's side. CAGE FIRES AGAIN, just as - - a SECOND javelin hits his FACEPLATE, it SHATTERS, the W SPINS, ARCS and Cage goes down, BLACKING OUT -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LATE-AFTERNOON SUN streaks through TORN CLOUDS. SMOKE rises from the SCORCHED EARTH and BODIES of men, aliens, machines litter the terrain for miles. A landscape of hel Cage COUGHS, OPENS HIS EYES. He's lying on his back, RAIN drizzling on his unprotected face, his BLOOD mixing in the puddles beside him. YONABUR BODY and the DEAD MIMIC SCOUTS are scattered around. A LIVING MIMIC is nearby, scavenging through the dead, ea bits of other fallen mimic. It hasn't noticed Cage, until CLICKING and WHIRRING, YONABURU'S EXOJACKET goes into pow down, releasing him like an insect's carapace. His dead, naked-except-for-underwear BODY slops into the mud and bl The eater of the dead LOOKS UP. Interested. ANOTHER MIMIC stands behind it. Oh fuck. Here they come. CAGE STRUGGLES to lift his 20mm, CLICK. CLICK. Nothing. T MIMICS RUN THIS WAY. CLICK. CLICK. Cage SCREAMS - - SHUP! The mimic's body is TORN IN HALF - A FLASH of RED EXOJACKET as THE SECOND IS CUT DOWN. We barely see it hap Just pieces of mimic falling, and in two seconds it's ove Cage blinks up at... RITA VRATASKI.  10. Her crimson exojacket shines in the afternoon sun. Her go spattered faceplate hovers over Cage, then RETRACTS as sh grabs a canteen from her utility belt. Rita may be the greatest warrior on the planet, but she c be more than 23 years old. And she's beautiful. Storm clouds part, BLUE SKY beyond, but rain still drizzl She drinks, looking up at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: When I grew up in Pennsylvania, they had a name for this.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: For... what?

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: For when it's raining, but the sun is shining. Rita lifts Cage's head, giving him some water.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They said it was because the devil was beating his wife. (beat) Who comes up with this crap? Cage trembles, COUGHS, blood sputters out.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Am I... gonna make it?

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: No. I don't think so. But I'll stay with you until you die.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: You don't have to... thank you, I -

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: I need your battery. It's fresh. Looks like you hardly used it. This sinks in.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: (bitterly) Take it.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: You sure about that?  11.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I don't deserve it. Rita gently pushes Cage over, unhooking something on his back. Cage grimaces in pain. He shivers, bloody, crying.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I... I don't want to die. Rita looks at him, a trace of painful softness in her fac

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Dying's not that bad, once you get used to it. Distant EXPLOSIONS, moving closer. Rita grabs her axe, he jacket whining up to full power, her radio CRACKLES to li

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have to go. Good luck, soldier.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Fuck... off... Rita smiles, then heads off to the CLIFF'S EDGE, surveyin the Armageddon in progress far below. Cage's jacket goes into power-down, unhooking from his bo With the last of his strength, he CRAWLS to Yonaburu's si

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (delirious) Yonaburu... I'm sorry... I... Yonaburu's one intact eye stares at him, blind and dead. SPLISH. SPLASH. Cage FREEZES. A MIMIC FOOT quietly steps into the mud by Cage's head. I standing right over him. This one is ODD, its armor plate and vesicles diffracting light in a OILY RAINBOW OF COLOR It LEANS IN CLOSE, SCANNING HIM. Cage TREMBLES, helpless. The thing's face is a HORRIBLE MAW - up close, it's no mo functional face than a black widow spider's hourglass is functional timepiece. A decorative WARNING to human prey. Detecting no threat from Cage, the mimic shifts focus to - RITA'S BACK. She's 20 yards away, too distracted by the battle to notice, as -  12. The mimic begins to VIBRATE, TINY BLACK TENDRILS exude fr every crevice of its armor, waving in the breeze. A FRESH JAVELIN forming in the center of its body, WHIRRING... And that's when Cage sees MRS. SMITH, Yonaburu's antique

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Cage GRABS the pistol, aims right up into the belly of th mimic, SHUTS his eyes and SQUEEZES THE TRIGGER - BLAM! Now a mimic could usually take a .357 slug and shrug it o but Cage got it RIGHT BETWEEN THE PLATES. With a hellish SQUEAL, the mimic STAGGERS, the developing JAVELIN MISFIR TEARING a hunk of the mimic's body with it - - Cage fires AGAIN. And AGAIN. INNARDS SPILL - SILVER-BLACK TENDRILS like melted plastic, CRACKLING with electrical charge, DRIZZLE ONTO CAGE'S BODY, at 600 degre CAGE SCREAMS as it BURNS INTO HIM. There are probably wor deaths, but this one ranks way up there. It's HORRIBLE - - Cage's DEATH-SCREAM scales register, the sound going fl and weird, squelching out like a bad RADIO SIGNAL as - - the IMAGE SHUDDERS, FALLING APART, winking out like an tube TV, a high pitched WHINE, a BUZZ and -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - CAGE SITS UP, SCREAMING, slapping at his chest like he' trying to put out a fire.

dialogues.speaker: AIGH
dialogues.text: He ROLLS off his bunk, FALLING to the floor, TEARING at h undershirt, revealing - HIS SKIN, perfectly intact, benea

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: What the fuck is wrong with you? YONABURU sits in his undershirt, cleaning MRS. SMITH, sta at Cage like he's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I was... it was... you were... Cage stares around like a trapped animal. SOLDIERS, the men and women we saw on the dropship, scatt around the barracks in various states of undress, stare b  13.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I, uh, I must have, uh... fallen asleep. Had a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: GUY CAT-CALL
dialogues.text: Didja piss yerself?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL CAT-CALL
dialogues.text: Check his diaper! There's a RECRUITMENT POSTER on Cage's wall: RITA VRATASK her crimson exojacket shining against blue sky, hair flyi a stern look on her face: "I WANT YOU! JOIN THE CLEANUP!" But someone - Cage, in fact - has defaced the poster to r "JOIN THE FUCK-UP, SUCKERS!" Little skulls around her fee NANCE, a tough-looking GIRL SOLDIER, burly as hell, leers

dialogues.speaker: NANCE
dialogues.text: Maybe it was a wet dream. Maybe he was dreamin' about Rita.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Shut up, Nance. She blows him a kiss. Cage rubs his head, in mild shock.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ow... GOD my head is killing me. I cannot drink like that anymore.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Like last night.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: We were here last night, dumbass. Liquor raid's tonight. Battle's tomorrow. Cage blinks, confused.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Oh. I... Right. I gotta, I think I gotta go puke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cage washes his face, taking two aspirin, hands shaking. looks in the mirror, trying to get a grip on himself -  14.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: It was just a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cage walks back to his bunk in a daze, staring at the fac of the SOLDIERS he just watched get killed; some playing video games, some looking at porn, some working out, some asleep, half-dangling out of Mylar hammocks. - there's DAVIS, who didn't make it out of the DROPSHIP - - there's ROKER, who took a JAVELIN in the chest - - and YONABURU, hunkering over a map that looks like foot strategy. PALKA, a short Norwegian, tosses him WIRE CLIPP

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Mission accomplished?

dialogues.speaker: PALKA
dialogues.text: We have our exfiltration point. Palka circles a spot on the map.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Excellent. We'll strike at 2200. Griff, you're gonna be the decoy -

dialogues.speaker: GRIFF
dialogues.text: You think they got tequila?

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: ‘Course they do. They're officers. They got everything.

dialogues.speaker: PALKA
dialogues.text: Going to get DRUUNK... Yonaburu rolls up the map, hiding it. Cage frowns, worrie

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Man, you ever feel like you're remembering something while it's happening, like it's already - (distracted) Hey, Ford! Can you not do that? SEVERAL SOLDIERS are GAMBLING between the bunks, heaps of goodies behind the WINNER, the LOSER throwing down his ca The dealer, FORD, scoops chips, smiling. He was missing t in the dropship... now he's not.  15.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Sarge busted our asses ALL DAY yesterday in PT! You wanna put everyone through that again?

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: What're you talking about? Sarge's out all week gettin' his arm sewed back on! Besides, we got a lookout - - indicating a FAT SOLDIER, KIMMEL, up near the door, who attention is evenly divided between a HANDHELD VIDEO GAME HIS NOSE, which he is picking mightily.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Dude, he came RIGHT through that door, and — SLAP! SOMEONE SLAPS KIMMEL on the back of his head, sendi his game skittering across the floor. Cage's eyes go WIDE

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Oh. Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: Now just what in the got-damned fucking shit do we have here? SGT. FARELL is a living piece of leather; badly scarred, as piss. Everyone is terrified of him, even his superiors Soldiers SCRAMBLE to attention, but it's FAR TOO LATE -—

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm gone for SIX WHOLE DAYS and my platoon, the platoon with MY good name on it, has TRANSMOGRIFIED into a veritable SHITSTORM of SHENANIGAN and INIQUITY! I. AM. APPALLED! Farell punctuates everything he says with VIOLENCE; a wel aimed KICK, a SLAP, a tipped-over FOOTLOCKER, as the sold FALL OVER EACH OTHER to come to ATTENTION -

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are ALL. IN. DEEPEST. SHIT.

dialogues.speaker: PIG. SHIT. YOU. MOTHERLESS. BABIES
dialogues.text: SLAP! KICK! No one escapes his reach.  16.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you will NOT. GET. OUT of this pigshit until you have EACH. AND. EVERY. ONE learned the life-giving power of FEAR and DISCIPLINE, the NECESSITY of ORDER and ETHIC if I have to personally KILL every SINGLE ONE of you embarrassing sacks of human waste and drag your DEAD and LIFELESS BODIES by the SHORTEST, CURLIEST HAIRS and throw you to the MIMIC HESSIANS! Two SOLDIERS exchange a look... did he just say "Hessians

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: DID you not think I would return? DID you not imagine that I would be wholly prepared to CASTRATE and MASTECTOMIZE each and every - Sgt. Farell stops short, seeing the GAMBLERS, who stand a attention... but their cards, chips are scattered everywh His face curls into a whole new level of acid rage.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (quietly) Oh. I see I've interrupted a game. A few GAMBLERS close their eyes, ready for certain death.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell me, Private Ford. Why do I hate gambling so much?

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: (trembling as he recites) Sir, because it's a game of chance, sir... because it entertains the notion that our... fate is in hands... other than our own... sir.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: And what do I think about chance?

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: (reciting) "There is no chance. There is only choice. And choice is character. And character is fate."

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: That's RIGHT!  17. He SLAPS Ford anyway, for good measure. Silence. Farell s the terrified soldiers in hateful wonder. His voice drops to an almost tender register, as if he pi these poor pukes for the choices they have made this morn

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now I know that none of you exactly CHOSE to be here. I know that all the young ladies and gentlemen FIT for the International Marine Forces have long since been decimated by the MIMIC DISEASE, and that no sooner have you conscripts completed the most RUDIMENTARY training than you are to be thrown into what is GUARANTEED to be the Mother of all Battles: RUBY TUESDAY. (softly) We lost North America. We lost the Pacific. We lose this, we won't get to fight another. I would imagine the pressure... must be enormous. He scans their faces.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ask me if I care. ASK ME IF I CARE,

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Sir, do you -

dialogues.speaker: NO I DO NOT CARE. PT NOW NOW NOW
dialogues.text: The soldiers HUSTLE OUT. Cage stares, STUNNED, as we CUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GLASSY TOWER looms above a SPRAWLING MILITARY BASE on a BAY. The base is the size of a city, but it's only part o what will be the largest military operation in human hist

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It's called 'deja vu', man, which is French for been there, done that. Happens to everyone. FAR BELOW, the soldiers of C-Company run in loose formati  18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOREIGN BATTALIONS arrive, train - CHINESE REGIMENTS MARCH. RUSSIAN SOLDIERS BARK ORDERS. JAPANESE COMMANDOS SPAR IN EXOJACKETS. Cage looks around the field, sweating, dazed.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Dude, I knew everything he was gonna say. Every word.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: EVERYONE knew what Sarge was gonna say! He always says that shit. C-COMPANY soldiers RUN, past JEERING COMPANIES of better behaved soldiers who aren't getting PT'ed to death.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I swear... this is different. It's like... I'm remembering things that haven't even happened yet.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Fine. You had a dream, we were in battle, and everyone died. Only the Valkyrie saved you - and then you died.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: And the Sarge busting our asses out here, that was in your dream, too.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yeah... I think it was.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: OK then, Mr. Wizard. Tell me what happens next. Cage looks around the field, straining to remember.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Uhh... Kimmel's gonna pass out.  19. The fat Private STRUGGLES over an easy OBSTACLE, FARELL SCREAMING at him until... Kimmel FAINTS. MEDICS rush over

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Well I coulda' seen that coming.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well, now... Nance and Ford over there, they're about to get in this big-ass fight... NANCE and FORD power over a wall, Nance taking the opportunity to GRAB Ford's ass. He KICKS her, they FALL I THE MUD. It's ON. SGT. FARELL starts yelling, SOLDIERS start running over, egging them on -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...and then Roker over there makes a perfect shot... ROKER hits three BULLS-EYES, HOOTS. Yonaburu frowns, spoo

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...-and then Davis gets his leg stuck in the ropes... DAVIS swings over a rope obstacle, slips and ends up swin upside down, his leg tangled.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...and then Ford has to go to the infirmary after Nance busts his -

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: (scared) Shut UP, man, yer freakin' me out!

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: That's what I'm saying! Ford gets his teeth knocked out and then... Cage trails off, seeing that RITA has walked onto the fie trailed by her Dogs.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Holy fuck. It's Valkyrie One! Out of her jacket, Rita looks nothing like the amazon war you might expect. She's small. Delicate-looking.  20. Out of their jackets, the DOGS are, if anything, more menacing than on the field; muscled, tatted, scarred. The swagger in loose formation around Rita, true to their nam

dialogues.speaker: GRIFF
dialogues.text: (walking up) Damn. Looks like someone let the Full Metal Bitch outta her tower. Cage stares, bewildered. Soldiers gathered around the fig COME TO ATTENTION as RITA steps through - - and INTO THE FIGHT, where FORD swings at NANCE, missing leaving himself wide open. Nance SWINGS, her FIST coming SLOW MOTION, Ford's eyes WIDE, his nose: DOOMED -— - but RITA INTERCEPTS THE SHOT, catching Nance's fist wit audible SMACK. Ford staggers back. Everything STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: How about you two save this for the battle? FORD muddily salutes. So does NANCE. So does SGT. FARELL.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why are these soldiers in PT the day before battle, Sergeant?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: 3rd Platoon has a discipline problem, ma'am. I felt that a little physical exertion might help them grasp this important military concept.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: I see. With a nod from Rita, one of the Dogs HITS THE DIRT, assu a board-like position: the ISO-PUSHUP.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lt. Shep is demonstrating the iso- pushup. In Dog Company, we use it to practice discipline. The iso- pushup is the best training outside of a jacket you will get.

dialogues.speaker: NOW
dialogues.text: The whole PLATOON is in a PERFECT LINE, in a position tha could pass for torture; the ISO-PUSHUP. Not going up, not going down - just holding position.  21.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To control your exojackets you must control your body. To control your body, you must control your mind. SWEAT drips from soldiers' noses. It's hardest for the biggest ones. Yonaburu TREMBLES - and COLLAPSES.

dialogues.speaker: GET BACK INTO POSITION, PRIVATE
dialogues.text: Yonaburu struggles to get back up. Cage can't take his ey off Rita. Rita suddenly LOOKS THIS WAY. Shit. Here she co

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: This man's had enough.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am. Yonaburu gets up. The lolling DOG SOLDIERS smirk. Rita DR assuming Yonaburu's place, next to Cage. Cage tries to ke his eyes on the ground, but finally, he looks - Sergeant-Major Rita Vrataski is looking Cage dead in the

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: (quietly) Do I have something on my face, Private?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Uh... No, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Then I suggest you keep your eyes on the ground. Cage looks down, sweat dripping. OTHER SOLDIERS DROP, one one. Rita holds the position effortlessly. Cage is shakin He finally DROPS.

dialogues.speaker: OVER BY THE WATER COOLERS
dialogues.text: Cage GUZZLES, watching Rita, now the only one doing an is pushup, her DOGS cheering her on. Yonaburu SLAPS Cage on the back -

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Damn. What'd she SAY to you, man?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Nothing, I -  22.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: You really had me going there for a minute. I mean, you didn't dream about any of that, Rita comin' over and her talkin' to you 'n stuff... did you?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: No. That wasn't... that's not what happened at all.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Good. I was starting to think you were crazy.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: (troubled) Yeah. Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UP FRONT, nervous-looking EXECUTIVE OFFICERS, pencil-push point to vidscreens, where MIMICS and BATTLE PLANS hover FLAGS showing armies of EVERY NATIONALITY cruise in towar the YUCATAN PENINSULA, while the island of CUBA - all of Caribbean, in fact - is SWARMED with GLOWING RED LINES th extend halfway around the globe; MIMIC FORCES.

dialogues.speaker: EXECUTIVE OFFICER
dialogues.text: The mimic are amassing on the island of Cuba, preparing for an all-out strike on the continent. When they reach a critical mass, they will attack. ON THE VIDSCREENS, whole CONTINENTS have been wiped clean human influence; NORTH AMERICA is gone, ANTARCTICA is gon Areas of CANADA appear to be DISEASED...

dialogues.speaker: EXECUTIVE OFFICER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's why we're striking them first. If we wait, we could lose South America. So this is what you'd call a, uh, critical juncture. IN BACK, soldiers from Cage's platoon pay limited attenti They're working on their own plans: tonight's liquor raid

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: You're still coming with us, right?  23.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I don't know, maybe -

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Come on, man, it's ritual. C- Company ALWAYS gets drunk before they go into battle!

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: We've never been in a battle.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: But that's how rituals get STARTED, wuss. We're in on the GROUND FLOOR. Cage can't exactly argue with this logic. As the meeting adjourns, Farell WAYLAYS them all at the door.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: 3rd Platoon, HOLD! Farell gives them all the bad-eye.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, Command doesn't let me ride your sorry asses past 1900 hours. But if any of you maggots have the spine and mettle to meet me in the sparring bay, I can offer in-jacket training. The soldiers guiltily file past. Not one takes him up on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONE SOLDIER hands bottles of LIQUOR under the edge of the Mylar tenting while OTHERS keep a lookout. A CURIOUS MP shines his flashlight on the fence -

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: (hissing) Go! GO! But when the curious MP gets there he sees - NOTHING BUT EMPTY GRASS behind the club. We pan ALONG the fence, to where the last of the soldiers slip through the HOLE that Palka made this morning -  24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRUNK SOLDIERS run around in the breakers, hooting and laughing, total grab-ass. SEARCHLIGHTS span the beach nea

dialogues.speaker: ROKER
dialogues.text: No, no no no no man, LOOK. I totally watched the whole thing - it's gonna be a cakewalk. SOLDIERS gather around, soaking wet and getting wasted. ROKER, with drunken authority, DRAWS A MAP THE SAND -

dialogues.speaker: ROKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is first division. This is 2nd, 84th - all the fuck of ‘em. They're all over. WE... (drawing) ».+.are gonna be right down here. Bringin' up the rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he uses a broken seashell to demark a spot, or a be bottle. One of the soldiers is totally naked, no explanat

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Bringin' up the rear. That's funny.

dialogues.speaker: ROKER
dialogues.text: It's a fuckin' CAKEWALK, man. We drew the lucky straw!

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: It's cos they know how bad we suck.

dialogues.speaker: ROKER
dialogues.text: Same difference. Two soldiers try some version of a high-five, and FALL on their asses. SURF washes in, destroying the battlefield. CAGE sits off by himself, staring out at the breakers. Yonaburu staggers over, sits.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: You're not still thinking about all that deja-bullshit are you?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Nah. Not really.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Good. Yonaburu offers cage a BOTTLE. Cage hesitates, DRINKS.  25. IN THE DISTANCE, we see the RED FLASHES of artillery. Low THUMPS echo across the water. BOMBING raids on the island

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers of 3rd Platoon creep back into their barrack O.S. The sound of someone PUKING. Yonaburu is clutching a worn photo, too drunk to walk. Cage helps him to his bunk

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: .--when this battle's over, I'm gonna get my gold star and we're gonna have like fifteen fuckin' kids and live off of the Breedin' Credits... Yonaburu collapses into bed, dropping the picture. Cage p it up. A sorta-pretty girl. "I love you, Danny-boy".

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ain't she pretty?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yeah, man, now get some sleep. Cage crawls up onto his rack. Lays there, staring at the poster of Rita in the gloom.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, Cage?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: In that dream you had, about the battle... you uh, never said exactly what happened to me. BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I... uh, think you got away.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Uh... Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Cool. Well I won't let the mimics get you this time, man. I swear.  26. Cage stares into the darkness, worried, and we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALARMS BLEAT, RADIOS ECHO across the base, and everywhere STREAMS of SOLDIERS, millions of them, run to their deployments like ants. DROPSHIPS lift off in formation, HOVERCRAFT and MEGACARRI steam out of the bay, WAVES of STRIKEJETS BOOM THROUGH TH SOUND BARRIER, whisking off, faster than can be followed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROWS of EXOJACKETS line the walls as SOLDIERS pound in. E exojacket is custom fit, a soldier's name emblazoned on e SOME SOLDIERS look really excited to get in their jackets SOME look at theirs like they're iron maidens. Soldiers S to their underwear; exojackets need full body contact. GRIFF even strips off his underwear, OTHER SOLDIERS wince

dialogues.speaker: NANCE
dialogues.text: Aw Griff no one wants to see that!

dialogues.speaker: GRIFF
dialogues.text: I gotta feel free, man! Yonaburu's jacket CLICKS into place around his body, seal his arm down to his fingertips. Exojackets are stronger t steel, and microjointed for maximum mobility.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Woooh, LORDY! Welcome to the Plastic Fantastic Death Machine! He KNOCKS his polycarbonate arm, THUK-THUK, for good meas KIMMEL struggles to wedge into his jacket, having managed gain another 13 pounds since his fitting.

dialogues.speaker: KIMMEL
dialogues.text: Can someone, uh...

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Suck in. Yonaburu and ANOTHER SOLDIER push... With a GROAN, Kimmel fairly POPS into his suit as it POWERS UP, encasing him.  27.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFF
dialogues.text: (looking up) OH FUUCK. CAGE steps around the corner. His jacket FESTOONED with e AMMO, GRENADES, and so many GUNS that he can barely walk. Soldiers LAUGH as we PUSH IN on Cage's ANXIOUS FACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAGE looking, if anything, more terrified than before, DO BETWEEN HIS FEET as the BAY DOORS RETRACT, revealing - - CHOPPY SEAWATER flying by below. Cage SWALLOWS HARD. AC FROM CAGE, Griff is twitching, trying not to barf -

dialogues.speaker: GRIFF
dialogues.text: SIR yes SIR!

dialogues.speaker: NANCE
dialogues.text: You spit up your jacket, yer in for a world a' shit.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: You shit in your jacket, yer in for a world a' pain. Ford GRINS. This time, he's still got all his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Yo buddy, check it out. We got nothin' to worry about. I brought us life insurance. Mrs. Smith. Yonaburu taps MRS. SMITH against his faceplate. Cage's li begins to twitch. He squeezes his eyes shut.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: .+.+READY FOR DROP... HOLDING, AND -— CAGE DOESN'T WAIT. He hits his RELEASE, and DROPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAGE'S HYPERVENTILATING GASPS. YONABURU tumbles after -  28.

dialogues.speaker: WHOO-HOO
dialogues.text: Cage LOOKS UP in time to see the dropship TAKE TWO HITS, FLAMING SOLDIERS falling as the ship begins its death-spi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - WHAM! BEAT. A GASP as Cage's lungs refill, he staggers wobbly, WET SAND falling from his face-plate -

dialogues.speaker: WE MADE IT
dialogues.text: THREE OTHER soldiers stagger up out of their own craters

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: Cage WAVES HIS ARMS frantically, which gives the doomed soldiers exactly enough time to LOOK UP before - - 20 TONS OF FLAMING DROPSHIP CRASH DOWN on them. Cage is THROWN BACK from the impact, landing in two feet of surf.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Cage nods, dazed. They RUN. EVERYTHING is exactly like it was before, with one major difference: instead of drizzling rain, there's a THICK FO CAGE AND YONABURU MAKE IT TO THE TRENCH, falling in with other terrified soldiers, FARELL screaming to TAC-COM -

dialogues.speaker: I NEED SOME GODDAMN AIR SUPPORT
dialogues.text: GRIFF trembles, gripping his autocannon -

dialogues.speaker: GRIFF
dialogues.text: This isn't... It's like they fuckin' knew, man... it's like they KNEW! ON CAGE'S HEADS-UP, a RED DOT approaches the BLUE DOTS of company. Then MORE RED DOTS. EVEN MORE THAN LAST TIME.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: We have to get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: LIGHT 'EM UP
dialogues.text: ROKER jumps up, ready to FIRE, when a MIMIC JAVELIN hits square in the chest, knocking him back - YONABURU stares down at the dead man, in shock, and sees - CAGE, ALREADY RUNNING AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: SHIT
dialogues.text: Sgt. Farell SNARLS, lowers his 30mm cannon at Cage's BACK

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: WAIT! I'll get him back, sir! BLAM! A BLAST of FLAME and SAND as a mimic JAVELIN lands the TRENCH. Maybe Farell is dead, but there's no time to back. YONABURU RUNS AFTER CAGE -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE RUNS BLINDLY -
dialogues.text: - YONABURU TACKLES HIM and they GO DOWN, ROLLING. Cage WRIGGLES FREE, crawls away. YONABURU GRABS his ankle, MIMIC JAVELIN streaking past -

dialogues.speaker: I'M NOT LETTING YOU GO
dialogues.text: Yonaburu HEAVES CAGE BACK by the ankle - JUST LIKE BEFORE

dialogues.speaker: CAGE SEES
dialogues.text: TWO MIMIC JAVELIN streaking in -

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: - Cage TWISTS, KICKING YONABURU and KNOCKING him out of t LINE of FIRE - - a javelin NEATLY MISSING Yonaburu's head.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Why the FUCK'D YOU DO THAT?  30. Cage stares in wonder - SMILES.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I DID IT! I SAVED YoU! LAUGHING, like he broke a CURSE. But then Cage COUGHS. Something DARK spatters the inside of his faceplate. Yonaburu's expression turns to one of horror.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Oh buddy. Oh man. Yonaburu stares at Cage's chest. Cage looks down - THERE'S A 90MM HOLE CLEAN THROUGH HIS CHESTPLATE. Took ou enough spine that he didn't feel anything.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh god, I'm sorry, man, I'm really - Cage looks BACK AT THE TRENCHES where the rest of the pla are getting HAMBURGERED in the FOG - - and the distant flash of RED where RITA and the DOGS fi a SEA OF MIMIC TWO-LEGGERS. Cage's jacket starts to TWIST shake, it's gonna JITTERBUG - And then YONABURU'S whole head DISAPPEARS IN A PUFF OF RE The image SWIMS, the sound FUTZING like a lost HAM RADIO TRANSMISSION as Cage BLEEDS OUT, DYING - - the weird static rising to a BUZZY ROAR until we CUT TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAGE WAKES UP ON his BUNK, COUGHING AND HACKING AND GASPI falling out of bed with a YELL. Everyone STARES. Yonaburu scowls up from cleaning Mrs. Smith.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: What the fuck is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Didja piss yerself? Cage stares around the barracks like a trapped animal.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yonaburu. You, uh, gotta help me man, you gotta — (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) Come with me. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cage explains, crying. Yonaburu frowns, listening.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: .--and then, then I ran, I couldn't help it. I just had to, there wasn't... You don't know what it's like. There's gonna be thousands, I mean, hundreds of thousands of ‘em. (wiping his nose) And anyway, I did save you, for like a second. For just a second. MAN, my fuckin' head hurts. Cage messily shakes out some aspirin, chewing several.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know it sounds crazy, but you gotta believe me. We have to get out of here or it's... Yonaburu looks at Cage with a mixture of pity and disgust His friend has totally cracked.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You do believe me, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Um, of course I do, man. (carefully) Let's, uh, get back in there, OK? And pretend like everything's all right. We, uh, really need to think this through, come up with a plan.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Thanks, buddy. You're the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SGT. FARELL is forcing to Ford to recite -

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: That's RIGHT!  32. Sgt. Farell SLAPS Ford, for good measure, and sees —

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now what the shit do we have here?

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: PRIVATE YONABURU and PRIVATE CAGE, SIR. WE WERE IN THE LATRINES.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: You needin' COMPANIONSHIP? The pornvids ain't ENOUGH for you?

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: NO SIR, PRIVATE CAGE is SICK, GONE

dialogues.speaker: SECTION EIGHT, SIR
dialogues.text: Cage stares at Yonaburu, BETRAYED.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: We're ALL Section Eight here, Private! Case of the WILLIES ain't enough to -

dialogues.speaker: HE'S CRAZY AS A SHITHOUSE RAT, SIR,
dialogues.text: PRIVATE CAGE SAYS HE -—

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: You said you'd help me! Cage TACKLES Yonaburu. SOLDIERS HOOT, they love a good fi

dialogues.speaker: GOD DAMN IT, GET 'EM OFFA HIM
dialogues.text: But not before Yonaburu, way the hell bigger than Cage, l a real proper PUNCH. Cage hits the floor, face first - Bleeding, disoriented, Cage is HAULED UP -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - and onto a GURNEY. His hands are ZIP-TIED. A NURSE dres his split eyebrow. A MEDIC shines a light in Cage's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC
dialogues.text: And you say you're from the... future? But only... thirty-six hours?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think, I mean, no. It's not like that. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's just that I can SEE it. Everything that's gonna happen. But like I dreamed it. Before.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC
dialogues.text: Ah. I see.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: (trembling) We're all gonna die tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC
dialogues.text: Mmm-hmm. Well, you're gonna be right here on base, safe 'n sound, Private. We'll see to that. Nurse? The nurse hefts a sizeable HYPO-GUN to Cage's head.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now you may feel a little pressure -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Wait... NO! Cage FREAKS, KNOCKING the hypo away from his head, the nu FIRES anyway and the needle PLANTS itself in - - the MEDIC'S ARM. The Medic's eyes glaze over like he's given an instant lobotomy. Cage twists, grabbing a BONE S

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now listen, don't... uh, don't screa -— The nurse SCREAMS at the top of her lungs. Cage saws the tie off his hands and backs out the door -

dialogues.speaker: AND INTO THE HALL
dialogues.text: RUNNING, ass hanging out of the medical gown. More SCREAM

dialogues.speaker: AND TO THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: - where FAT COOKS make all manner of shitty food, and amo the STEAM and cookpots CAGE is hunkering, hiding, running

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - CAGE RUNS out the back, dressed in someone else's cloth the base busy with TRUCKS and PEOPLE, he keeps his head l - PAST the TRAINING fields where his PLATOON is in PT -  34. - and OFF HIS SHOULDER, MPs are running out of the door, the NURSE pointing, but Cage is already - SLIPPING BEHIND THE OFFICERS' CLUB, distant ALARMS GOING as he finds the PIECE OF FENCE that PALKA cut for the liq raid. He SLIPS THROUGH, putting it back as best he can an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cage HITS the beach at a LOPE, staying close to the cliff the guard towers can't see him, running until the base, t BAY FULL OF SHIPS, disappear behind him, and - - BEAUTIFUL WHITE SANDS extend in front. Blue skies above throws off his hat. Cage is free. AWOL, but free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEABIRDS CAW. A BEAUTIFUL LITTLE GIRL is playing in the s A SHADOW FALLS OVER HER. She looks up, scared - But it's Cage, smiling down at her, out of breath, sunbur

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Hi there, little girl!

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: An OLD MAN in a STRAW HAT is fishing in the surf, wearing high boots. He waves, reeling line, coming this way.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: Ain't hardly any more fish these days, but I want her to know how to do it. For when they come back. (eyeing Cage's bandage) You from the base?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I mean, no. I was. I'm out.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: (a funny look) Well it's a damn fine day to be out. The old man's fishing line WHIRRS, the pole YANKS. He sta reeling in line. A postcard-perfect scene...

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: Pretty!  35. The little girl POINTS. Cage FROWNS. The water at the girl's feet is covered in an iridescent, sickly SHEEN. A DEAD fish rolls in the oily surf. Cage instinctively picks her up, taking her to dry sand as - THE OLD MAN wades into the oily water, reeling in line to whatever it's snagged on. Something dark, moving, BIG... «++-A MIMIC AQUA-SCOUT RAISES ITSELF OUT OF THE WATER. The thing is segmented, 9' tall, too many eyes, water pou off of it. ANOTHER MIMIC rises BEHIND IT, EAGERLY INTERES

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: Cage looks back just in time to see the old man WHACKING the MIMIC with his fishing pole before he's CUT TO SHREDS Cage COVERS the little girl's eyes and RUNS.

dialogues.speaker: HELP
dialogues.text: But no one's around. The SPUT! SPUT! of mimic JAVELINS an THUK! The world GOES RED, at a BAD ANGLE. Cage is on the sand, looking up, grasping for the little girl -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: R-run... He can't crawl to her because his LOWER HALF is six feet behind him. The MIMIC SCOUT advances, javelins BLOOMING across its body like flowers -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: «..I'm sorry... The last thing Cage sees is her shoe in the sand. The gir SCREAM warbles, detuning into a weird DISTORTED HUM as th image ARTIFACTS, FALLING APART, BUZZING and we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cage opens his eyes. Tears on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cage washes his hands, looking awful. The water whisks do the drain in the sink.  36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yonaburu is carefully cleaning Mrs. Smith when Cage walks eyes rimmed red, a faraway look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: You OK, buddy?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Can I see that for a minute?

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: No one touches Mrs. Smith but me. (smiling) Aw, man, I'm just pullin' yer leg. Yonaburu hands the pistol over, butt first. Cage takes the gun, chambering one of the bullets that Yonaburu has taken out and placed on a crate.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, what are you -—

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry, buddy. He puts the gun to his temple. We don't see it happen. We see the faces of EVERYONE IN T BARRACKS yelling NO and a terrible, distant THUMP and the - the YELLS detune, the image SHUDDERS APART and we CUT T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cage opens his eyes. He doesn't move for a long time, jus listens to the sound of the barracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water pours down the drain-hole in the sink. Cage sta at it. He cracks open a bottle of aspirin. Takes two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YONABURU hunkers over the map of the liquor raid, marking locations with a sharpie. Cage stares at the poster of Rita. JOIN THE FUCKUP, SUCKE  37.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: (frowning) Yonaburu, I got a question.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: If today was your last day on Earth, what would you do?

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: I'd probably get good and drunk. Which, as it turns out, I was already planning on doing. Cage nods distantly.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: You wanna get some breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: No, I don't wanna "get some breakfast". I got strategic plans to make. Cage walks through the barracks, lost in thought, looking everyone who will be gone tomorrow: soldiers gambling, soldiers sleeping... KIMMEL, intent on his game. Cage exits just as SGT. FARELL ENTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cage walks down the hall, a semi-blissful look on his fac Farell's YELLS echoing through.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Now just what in the got-damned fucking shit do we have here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cage puts his cup at a machine emblazoned "METACOFFEE: BE EVEN THAN THE REAL THING!" The dank liquid sputters in. Cage eats alone, wincing over the bitter drink. RITA and her DOGS enter, Rita getting food, finding a pla to sit. She walks in perfect slow motion, gliding through world like nothing can touch her, her face expressionless  38. One of the DOGS looks this way, giving Cage a deadly look Cage looks away. Finishing, he dumps his tray.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN GIRL
dialogues.text: Having a good day?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I've had worse. Mind if I borrow your pen? Cage writes "5" on the back of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN GIRL
dialogues.text: What's that for?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I, uh, keep dying, and then waking up again. Figured I better start keeping track, you know? The girl smiles politely, afraid of this crazy person.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Would you happen to know where the holovid library is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STARS, one billion of them, serenely float in the firmame of space, until - A SILVER, BULLET-LOOKING THING WHISKS PAST, at near light speed. Only it's not a bullet. It's... a MIMIC SEEDER.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was only three years old when the mimic first got here. CAGE stands in the dark HOLOBAY, the seeder STREAKS past

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They'd probably started heading this way a thousand years before I was even born. EIGHT MORE MIMIC SEEDERS follow suit, smoothly fanning ou into geostationary orbits above... the EARTH, at Cage's F

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LITTLE BOY and his FATHER stand on a dark hill, the lig of a CITY far below, the father pointing up.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My dad used to take me up on a hill and show me their satellites. I thought they were pretty. TINY SILVER SPECKS shine low in the sky. The boy stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT THE UNITED NATIONS, POLITICIANS ARGUE under IMAGES of strange spheroids. MILITARY OFFICIALS scowl suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We tried everything we could to communicate with them. IN LOW-EARTH ORBIT, A SPACE STATION revolves near a SEEDE ...the station SHOOTS a LASER at the seeder. After a beat EXPLODES. MILITARY OFFICIALS watching monitors CLAP... ...BUT THEN, in a slow-motion ballet, each of the remaini SPHEROIDS evenly FRAGMENTS into smaller pieces...

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then one day, they just dropped. .--and all the pieces DROP. The GENERALS' HAPPY FACES fil with dread, watching international reports stream in. ONE OF THEM lands on a CITY, OBLITERATING SEVERAL BUILDIN and landing DEEP IN THE EARTH - The images RACE FORWARD, Cage FAST-FORWARDING TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - A DAVID ATTENBOROUGH-TYPE pushes through RAINFOREST, le LOINCLOTHED TRIBESMEN.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They'd gotten down deep, and were showing up all over the place. They come to a HUGE EMPTY SPOT in the forest, the denuded Earth covered in an OIL-SLICK-LOOKING GOO, where THOUSAND PILLBUG-LIKE HALF-SPHERES work their way out in a circle.  40.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Everything they touched, died. A TRIBESMAN kicks one over. Hundreds of LEGS wave in the until he STABS it with a SPEAR, and we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEEMING with the SILVER, BUG-LIKE THINGS. FAMILIES watch CLEANUP CREW comes in and starts EXTERMINATING the plague

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Then they started mutating. An EARLY VERSION of a MIMIC raises itself out of the hole WALKING UPRIGHT - ROUGHLY HUMANOID. It SPRAYS the CLEANUP CREW with some kind of ACID. MAYHEM ensues, people SCREAMING, running every which way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLUMES of brownish SMOKE rise above ARCTIC ISLANDS, a U.D BOMBING RAID in process. The ground ERUPTS with MIMIC.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They always seemed to know where we would attack next, and the more we attacked them, the better they got. NEW KINDS of MIMIC INFANTRY pour out of holes in the eart like rudimentary versions of the human weaponry they are modeled on. Some SHOOT, some FLY. Some are FAST, some BIG

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They fought like us. After a while, they even looked like us. Kind of. We see a SOLDIER cornered with a MIMIC, it GRABS the sold The soldier SCREAMS - - the mimic makes a SCREAMING SOUND back, the shifting PL on its horrible face MIMIC the soldier's EXPRESSION - Then the face COMES APART, turning to WHIRRING BLADES: SP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOCTORS in a lab DISSECT a MIMIC TWO-LEGGER -  41.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mimic had no brain, no signs of self-awareness or fear. Scientists claimed they were more like robots than living things. But they didn't look like robots and they didn't act like robots. - part of the mimic ANIMATES and with only a HALF of a bo KILLS the doctors, SMASHING the lab -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They acted more like zombie space killers from hell. The HALF-MIMIC closes in on the camera. It's made of LAYE like one of those Russian dolls with other dolls inside - BLACK and SILVER OOZING out around its one good EYE - It SMASHES the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWATHS of OCEAN have turned a weird, opalescent GREEN. WH CONTINENTS are turning a DEADLY GRAY... ORANGE CLOUDS PART, and far below, the JAGGED remains of FLORIDA PENINSULA jut into the rising ocean.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It wasn't until the Battle of Florida that things turned around. A MILLION-SOLDIER INTERNATIONAL FORCE fights the MIMIC HO on the CHARRED remains of DISNEYLAND, as - RITA VRATASKI, wearing an early STANDARD-ISSUE EXOJACKET, LEADS the HUMAN FORCES TO VICTORY, DECIMATING MIMIC.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: She was only 19 years old. It was her first battle. She kills the LAST, her faceplate OFF, hair slick with sw LIFTED on the ARMS of her COMRADES -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERAS FLASHING, Rita looking lost and alone.  42.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No one knew how she did it. When the press asked her how a nineteen- year-old girl who had never been in battle was suddenly able to kill four thousand mimic and turn the tide of the war, she simply said:

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: (nervously leaning to mic) I, uh... play a lot of video games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAGE, a be-zitted, lazy-looking TEEN on his stepfather's couch, powers down CHEETOS, watching the holovid of Rita.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: When I was nineteen, I was still living on my stepfather's couch, staying up all night watching holovids and praying my service card would never come. Cage's STEPFATHER brings him a SHINY BLUE CARD. Cage star at his card, Cheeto dust on mouth, in shock -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But of course my card came. They always do. - while ON-SCREEN, Rita bows her head, receiving a MEDAL; ORDER OF THE VALKYRIE, the only one of its kind. She look out at the stadium, camera flashes flicking like stars. But she doesn't look very happy. Rita looks out at the STADIUM-SIZE CROWD, indifferent, as - - a single TEAR ROLLS DOWN HER CHEEK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita's TEAR is COMMEMORATED IN RECRUITMENT POSTERS that decorate the CRUMBLING WALLS of the BURNED-OUT SUBURB. “JOIN THE CLEANUP!"

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They were still calling it the cleanup, which was stupid because everyone knew it was all-out war. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Earth was dying, the weather was getting totally screwed up. It was them or us. CAGE is loaded onto a transport, with other young MEN and WOMEN who look just as shit-scared as he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An INCOMPREHENSIBLY LARGE MILITARY BASE covering the Yuca Peninsula. ARMED FORCES from all over the planet ARRIVING - and the SILVERY MIMIC HORDE covering the distant ISLAND enough to be visible from SPACE -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Battle of Ruby Tuesday was going to be the big one. It was a gamble. Humanity was going all in. If we lost this one, there wouldn't be anyone left to fight another.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BASE
dialogues.text: Cage gets off the truck, looking particularly out of plac the same look on his face as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAGE, sitting among a thousand SOLDIERS.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A lot of people were scared. But me, I'd actually been there. I knew exactly how it was going to go. STRATEGIC MAPS of tomorrow's battle hover in the darkness EXECUTIVE OFFICERS (XO's) point, highlighting the animate BATTALIONS that will be landing tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I knew we were gonna lose.

dialogues.speaker: EXECUTIVE OFFICER
dialogues.text: ...the main points of attack will be two miles north of this canyon here, where we expect the mimic to stage their front line. lst Corp. will be taking most of the heat. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: EXECUTIVE OFFICER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your job will be to scoop up fleeing mimic infantry, prevent a breach here... or here. We'll be giving it all we've got, so -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I have a question, sir. The XOs SQUINT, interrupted. Their eyes adjust... CAGE is the only soldier among a thousand who is standing

dialogues.speaker: EXECUTIVE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Yes, Private? Cage coughs nervously.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Um... what if the mimic already know what we're planning? Wouldn't the breach point be more heavily defended than any other area?

dialogues.speaker: SENIOR XO
dialogues.text: Son, mimic don't work that way.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFF
dialogues.text: (whispered) - dude, sit the fuck down -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah, but if they did, C- Company'd get stuck between the cliffs and the canyon. And from that elevation, they'd, um, probably be able to make mincemeat of the advance dropship deployment before we even touch down. SGT. FARELL takes an interest.

dialogues.speaker: NERVOUS XO
dialogues.text: Our intel says the mimic are massing north of the drop point.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: What if the intel is wrong? The XOs look even more nervous. And irritated.

dialogues.speaker: SENIOR XO
dialogues.text: Son, we can't plan for every eventuality. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SENIOR XO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C-Company and all the 81st will be one of the luckier divisions; it's a backup position. Now unless we have any other wild theories to entertain, this debriefing is ended. Good luck tomorrow, soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: - teacher's fuckin' pet - The soldiers stand to file out, giving Cage not-cool look SGT. FARELL begins his spiel about in-jacket training.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Dude, what the fuck was that?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I just thought someone should say something.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Yeah, something totally insane. You still doing the liquor raid with us tonight or what?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Maybe next time.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Next time? Battle's tomorrow, dumbass.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I'm sure it'll be fun without me.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Man, what's wrong with you? You've been acting like a dick all DAY.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFF
dialogues.text: Told you he'd puss out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cage wanders the gloomy, empty locker room. At his locker, he stares in at his empty exojacket, "CAGE emblazoned on front, like a coffin with his own name on i SGT. FARELL appears.  46.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: You asked some pretty good questions today, Private. Made the pencil pushers think. That took guts. Sign of a good soldier.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I'm not really a good soldier, sir. Farell sits, eyeing Cage in a new light.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: You're really worried about tomorrow, ain't you?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Sarge, what if you were going into battle and you knew you were going to die? What if you were, like, certain with one hundred percent certainty? Farell thinks on this, taking the question seriously.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: Then I wouldn't be afraid. (beat) That's what it takes to be a great soldier. Realize your doom and get on with it. Inflict the greatest damage you can on your enemy. And die a hero. Farell rubs his jaw, looking up at Cage's exojacket.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come to think of it, Private, that is the perfect condition in which to enter any battlefield situation. Cage stares at his empty jacket, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You meet me in the sparring bay if you want a little practice with that thing. Farell exits. Cage looks at the "5" written on his hand. CAGE PUTS ON HIS JACKET. The LEGS bind, the ARMS seal, th CHEST closes, every slick moving polycarbonate plate whir into place, as SYSTEM CHECKS fill the faceplate. Cage picks up his AUTOCANNON and we CUT TO:  47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cage steps in, looking around. The bay is a vast, echoing space the size of an airplane hangar.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Sarge? Farell strikes without warning. WHAM! Cage goes down in a tumble, Farell knocking him sprawling.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: Forget about the jacket. WHAM. Cage struggles to stand. He's really bad at this.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Forget about me. At every turn, Farell is delivering blows to poor Cage, h jacket STRAINS, firing "STREAKERS": AUGMENTED-REALITY - MUNITIONS that can only be seen from inside the faceplate

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Use your instincts and the jacket will help you. Don't think about it too much. Don't fight the jacket. EVERYWHERE that Cage fires is milliseconds too late. And Sergeant isn't even firing back. He's playing with him, h moves Aikido-like, always using a foe against himself.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When you forget that you're wearing the jacket is when the soldier and the jacket are one. When the soldier and the jacket are one, the mimic cannot defeat you. Cage gives it all he's got, FINALLY landing a blow - WHAC

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good. And then Farell HAMMERS CAGE, KNOCKING HIM CLEAN OFF HIS FEET, jumping, landing on him, pinning his arms back and putting the barrel of his 50mm in Cage's face.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're green, but you've got more mettle than you think you do. Farell rolls off of him, smiling.  48.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now. You wanna try that again?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dropship bay doors OPEN, the OCEAN far below. Cage's jacketed hand is shaking. GRIFF making about-to-puke-face

dialogues.speaker: YES SIR
dialogues.text: UP FRONT, Farell gives them all a grim look. When his eye meet Cage, he gives him the tiniest nod of reassurance. BENEATH, the BEACH comes into view... and the DROP POINT.

dialogues.speaker: HOLDING... GO
dialogues.text: Soldiers DROP. YONABURU. NANCE. FORD. GRIFF. CAGE turns t TERRIFIED SOLDIER - maybe KIMMEL - who clings for his lif

dialogues.speaker: LET GO
dialogues.text: He shakes his head. Cage SHOVES him, forcing him out, the drops, SCREAMING. Cage THROWS ANOTHER, GRABS a THIRD just THE DROPSHIP TAKES THE HIT, AND THEY'RE OUT, TUMBLING and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAGE LANDS on the beach, WHAM! Several other soldiers sta up out of their craters. A happy soldier waves -

dialogues.speaker: WE MADE IT
dialogues.text: Cage TACKLES the SOLDIER, barely knocking him out of harm way as the DROPSHIP SMASHES DOWN - at least he saved one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STUNNED SOLDIER stares back at the ship, in shock -

dialogues.speaker: HAPPY SOLDIER
dialogues.text: The ship... the ship...

dialogues.speaker: COME ON
dialogues.text: They HAUL ASS across the beach. This time, it's POURING R

dialogues.speaker: THEY ROLL INTO THE TRENCH
dialogues.text: Yonaburu's heads-up is RED with mimic -

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Holy fucking fuck. Cage moves past his terrified comrades to SGT. FARELL, wh uselessly SCREAMS ORDERS to his RADIO -

dialogues.speaker: WELL, TAC-COM GOT IT FUCKIN' WRONG
dialogues.text: We need some GODDAMN AIR SUPPORT!

dialogues.speaker: THERE'S A CANYON, ONE CLICK WEST
dialogues.text: A split-second BEAT. Sgt. Farell believes him.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: Right! MOVE! MOVE! THE SOLDIERS MAKE IT OUT just as the trench is REDUCED TO RUIN by JAVELIN FIRE -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: (to Yonaburu)

dialogues.speaker: STAY WITH ME
dialogues.text: The soldiers RUN for the CANYON as - SEVERAL MIMIC RUNNERS detach and GIVE CHASE. Cage TURNS, LEVELS his 20mm, BLAM! A MIMIC GOES DOWN! FOLLOWING HIS L - TWO OTHER SOLDIERS turn to FIRE on the MIMIC but are OVERTAKEN. Hand to hand, the MIMIC are unstoppable, the T SOLDIERS are CUT DOWN as -  50.

dialogues.speaker: JAVELIN BLOOMING ACROSS ITS BODY, ARMS SHARP AS RAZORS. C
dialogues.text: ROLLS, TWISTS and as it LEAPS - He RAMS his PILEDRIVER in the mimic's CRAW - KERWHAM! The mimic DIES, javelin fizzling like dud fireworks.

dialogues.speaker: YEAH
dialogues.text: Yonaburu FIRES his 50mm, KICKING back like a 10 year old firing his first shotgun: BLAM! BLAM! Not too accurate, b

dialogues.speaker: C'MON, MAN
dialogues.text: CAGE grabs YONABURU's shoulder and they run until - - STRIKEJETS ROAR in, laying down a WALL OF FLAME, close enough that CAGE AND YONABURU are KNOCKED FLAT, DIRT in t SKY, MIMIC PIECES FALLING, it's hard to tell up from down CAGE staggers up, but YONABURU TOOK A PIECE OF SHRAPNEL.

dialogues.speaker: HOLD ON
dialogues.text: Cage GRABS Yonaburu's FOOT, DRAGGING HIM as FRESH MIMIC c the OILY SMOKE, Cage FIRING with his one FREE ARM —

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: I'm bleedin' out, man... Let me go.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: I... I'm sorry I called you a dick. (fading) You're my best... friend... Distracted, Cage doesn't see the MIMIC BARRELING at him -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Just hold on, man, I can get you - - a sickening CRUNCH and we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cage wakes up on his bunk. Yonaburu is cleaning Mrs. Smit Cage's bare feet hit the concrete floor. He stands there, smiling at Yonaburu.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: (frowning) What the fuck is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Nothing, man. Still smiling, Cage writes a "6" on his hand with a sharp

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Sarge was right. If there wasn't any way out of this, maybe I could at least go down fighting. So what if there were a million of them and only one of me. Maybe I had a million tries. KIMMEL'S FACE, intent on his video game. Two blocky, old- skool STREET FIGHTERS square off. One EATS the other's LI

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Maybe I could win this thing after all. GAME OVER. RESTART. Cage peers down at the game -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're getting pretty good at that, Kimmel. How many times would you Say you've played that game?

dialogues.speaker: KIMMEL
dialogues.text: I dunno. Couple thousand? I been able to beat it for a while - I'm just trying to top my own score.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Heads up, buddy, Sarge is coming.

dialogues.speaker: KIMMEL
dialogues.text: Huh? Cage steps up on his footlocker, addressing the room.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Hey everyone, I just thought you should all know that Sgt. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Farell got out of rehab early. He's on his way. He'll be here in one minute.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Bullshit. KIMMEL spies the Sarge, COMING DOWN THE HALL -

dialogues.speaker: KIMMEL
dialogues.text: Guys! Guys! The Sarge is coming! SOLDIERS respond like a bomb went off, flying into action hiding laundry, flipping gambling paraphernalia into lock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SGT. FARELL MARCHES DOWN THE HALL as if he knows in his h what he will find there. CAGE WAYLAYS HIM.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: Private.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: (scowling) Let me pass, private. Cage tries to waylay him again, Farell PUSHES past him an opens the door on -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - A SHOCKINGLY CLEAN quarters. SOLDIERS stand at attentio

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: Now just what in the got-damned - The Sergeant is totally brought up short. Cage steps in behind him and... begins to SING.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (SINGING)
dialogues.text: Fooooor he's a jolly good fellow, for he's a jolly good fellow, for he's a jolly good feee-ee-loooo- (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (SINGING)
dialogues.text: (wait for it) Who came back with both his arms. A weak improvised cheer goes up. Farell frowns.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: Well. I'll be damned. I'd heard a rumor this platoon'd fallen to the forces of Chaos. (beat) I don't usually take such pleasure in being wrong. He scans the place, inspecting, still suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right. We'll be reviewing Mimic Killzone Tactics on the field at 0900. Get yer breakfast. You, HOLD. Indicating Cage. Soldiers bustle out. Farell GLARES at Ca noticing that Cage has a "6" written on the back of his h

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don't know what game you're playing, Private... "Cage". But if you fuck with me, I will kill you.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Sir, yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRAPPY BREAKFAST FOOD hits metal trays. METACOFFEE splutt out of a machine. Yonaburu tastes some, scowling.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: What-all do they put in this shit?

dialogues.speaker: GRIFF
dialogues.text: Everything an exploding body needs.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: (to Cage) Dude, you TOTALLY saved our ASSES back there. Sarge woulda killed us! They SIT, eyeing - RITA, at a corner table, flanked by her DOGS, who sit aro not eating, looking bored.  54.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: I don't get it. She can eat whatever she wants but she comes in here, like she's gonna eat with us, and then she just eats by herself and doesn't even let anyone look at her. Not even her Dogs.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFF
dialogues.text: That's why they call her the Full Metal Bitch, man. She's mean. One of Dog Company notices them looking, gives their tabl the bad-eye while cleaning his fingernails with a dagger.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: (whispering) I heard she screws ‘em. ALL.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFF
dialogues.text: Naw, man, they're all homos. So she won't screw ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: You guys ever give it a rest?

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: She thinks she's better than us.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: She is better than us.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: I thought you hated her! You're always talking about how much you hate all her hero bullshit. “Join the fuck-up, suckers".

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: She's still the best. Cage eats, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You think one person could change a whole battle?

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: I dunno, man. Maybe if that person were Rita.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
