dialogues.text: What about me?  55.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Dude, you couldn't hit a barn if we dropped it on you.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yeah, but - what if I got a million tries? Like on Kimmel's video game?

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Mmmaaybe. Could you also, like, shoot laser beams out of your eyes or teleport or something?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I'm being serious.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: I know you're being serious. That's what's so frickin' funny. Rita stands, eyes ahead, and exits, the Dogs trailing.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: How long do you think it would take me to get as good as her?

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: (laughing) I dunno, three, four lifetimes? Cage smiles and we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cage ROLLS, EVADING TRACER FIRE, taking HITS. Tracers are real, but when they hit, exojackets give a SHOCK - OW!

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: What are you afraid of? A little sting? That ain't nothing! WHAM! WHAM! Cage is fast, but Farell is faster and FEARLE LEAPING off walls, FLIPPING, SHOOTING, raining HELL on Ca

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You think the mimic's afraid of death? I seen a mimic eat its own battle-buddy. I've seen a mimic throw itself into a dropship ramjet just to bring the thing down. It did not hesitate. There was no decision, only action.  56. Cage SWINGS his PILEDRIVER and we slip in TIME to -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Cage's PILEDRIVER OBLITERATES A MIMIC as he PUSHES the PLATOON farther up the canyon, SOLDIERS SCREAMING while h fires SEEKER SHELLS, targeting nine MIMICS at once -

dialogues.speaker: MOVE OUT
dialogues.text: Cage FIRES, turning, seeing MORE MIMIC LEAP off the CANYO RIM, one LANDING ON YONABURU and TEARING HIM TO SHREDS -

dialogues.speaker: GET IT OFF ME
dialogues.text: With a SCREAM, Cage LEAPS, FIRING DOWN BETWEEN HIS FEET -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - ALMOST LANDING ON FARELL, but Farell ROLLS, FIRES BACK, Cage is BETTER NOW - HACKING DOWN with his 20mm, his TRAC

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: You gotta fight with more than pea- shooters if you wanna WIN - - Farell THROWS his repeater cannon aside and LEAPS, enga Cage HAND TO HAND, TOO CLOSE for any of his weapons to wo They're PUNCHING, KICKING, Cage taking the worst of it, dizzy, STAGGERING back like a boxer up against the ropes.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: Then FIGHT, DAMN YOU! Farell is RELENTLESS, BEATING THE HELL OUT OF CAGE -  57.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Recognize your weakness and DO

dialogues.speaker: SOMETHING ABOUT IT
dialogues.text: - until Cage YELLS, FIGHTING BACK, RAINING BLOWS ON -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - the THICK HIDE OF A MIMIC, its sharp limbs moving FAST BUZZ SAWS as it LEAPS on him again, Cage BARELY deflectin then HITTING BACK, landing BLOW AFTER BLOW and - KICKING the MIMIC into a TWITCHING HEAP. Cage gets up, SWEATING, a little BLOOD inside his faceplate, BARELY ABL STAND after his first real hand to hand with a mimic. Soldiers CHEER.

dialogues.speaker: ROKER, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: WOO-HOO! That's some FIGHTIN'!

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Where'd you learn that shit? Cage crouches, looks up at the SUN, high in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: What time you got?

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: 11:45. Why you keep asking me what fuckin' time it is?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Just wanna see how far I can get. Yonaburu FROWNS, is going to ask more... but here come MO MIMICS, DRIVEN by RITA. Cage WATCHES HER FIGHT. It's as if Rita can't kill mimics fast enough. While her is cutting one in half, she's twisting another mimic arou forcing it to FIRE into one of its MATES - Cage FOLLOWS, watching. But then RITA notices his follow.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: You ought to keep your distance, private. You might get hurt. She CROUCHES, LEAPS off, moving faster than Cage can poss follow. The DOGS go after her. A STRIKEJET SORTIE coming  58.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: We gotta get out of here, man. Sarge wants us to —

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yeah, just a - YONABURU! LOOK OUT! - a STRIKEJET SPINS OUT OF CONTROL, GRAPPLED with a MIMIC and CRASH-LANDS ON YONABURU with an EXPLOSION and we CUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldiers cross a SWAMPY AREA between CRAGGY CLIFFS. Cage WADES after RITA, watching her FIGHT -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: What time we got?

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: 12:45. Man, why the hell do you keep asking me what - AIGH! An AQUATIC MIMIC comes OUT OF THE WATER, this one with JA in its TORSO. It BITES Yonaburu in HALF -

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Cage FIRES and we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On STEEP MOUNTAIN FACE, where CAGE can see RITA, BELOW, dispatching MIMIC by the dozen.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Man how does she MOVE like that?

dialogues.speaker: SHHHH.
dialogues.text: Yonaburu POINTS. ABOVE THEM, SEVERAL MIMIC watch the batt Yonaburu carefully takes a GRENADE, pulls the PIN, THROWS They HUG to the cliff face, CROUCHING... .--but the grenade ROLLS BACK DOWN, coming to rest right under YONABURU'S ASS. He doesn't see it.  59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPLUT! Some NASTY-looking stew hits a cafeteria tray. Cage is in line with everyone else. Unlike everyone else, he's piling food of every imaginable variety on his plate Adding salt, sugar, spices. Anything to break the monoton

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Goddamn, man. That's disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Well, Yobo, you gotta keep life interesting.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Yobo? What's that?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Just a name I've got going for you.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Dude don't call me that. It's weird.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I'm gonna call you that. (to the kitchen girl) Mind if I borrow your pen?

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN GIRL
dialogues.text: Sure. Cage writes "93 - KIA 2:32" on his hand. Yonaburu frowns.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Man, you're acting really weird today.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: You don't know the half of it. Rita walks by, head down, in perfect slow-motion.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: I don't get it. She can eat whatever she wants but she comes in here, like she's gonna - Watching her, distracted, Cage COLLIDES with one of the D  60.

dialogues.speaker: HEELER
dialogues.text: Private, you don't even LOOK at Sergeant-Major Vrataski. Yonaburu's eyes go wide. Heeler PUSHES Cage. Cage PUSHES back. The mess hall goes still.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Right. Cage SWINGS his tray. He's pretty fast. Maybe if he were an exojacket he might stand a chance against these guys, he weighs half as much as any one of them. THEY'RE ALL OVER HIM, Cage gets in one last good punch an then Heeler swings, the fist CONNECTS and we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SLOW-MOTION EXPLOSION. RITA steps through the smoke, looking insanely awesome, in an EARLIER EDITION of her crimson exojacket. The image FAST-FORWARDS... CAGE stands in the holobay, intently studying Rita's move He switches out holodisks and - ANOTHER IMAGE of Rita at the end of a battle, exhausted. A CAMERAMAN pushes a camera in her face as she's drinking she HURLS the bottle at the CAMERA, the image WINKING OUT Cage shuttles back, to the frame before she hurls the bot Cage freezes that frame. Rita is beautiful. And in that one frame, she looks like loneliest person in the whole world. Cage walks around the LIFESIZE HOLOGRAM, looking at her closely. He studies her melancholy face. She's frozen, standing in front of him like a translucent ghost... Their faces almost touching. But she's just a holovid image. Cage gestures, the image moves out of STILL, into MOTION - Rita's holovid bottle FLIES at Cage's face and we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARELL LANDS a punch, Cage barely feels it, twisting and fending Farell off with one hand. Farell finally KICKS hi sending him flying. Cage lies on his back, frowning.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: You... had enough?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: How do you think she got so good? Farell stands over Cage, bent over, out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Valkyrie One. The Full Metal... Rita. Farell sits on a bench, easing off his faceplate. He pull two apples out of his jacket. Hands Cage one, eats.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: You've seen her fight?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I, uh... watch old warvids. (beat) No one can move as fast as her. I don't know how she does it. Farell eats his apple, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: Prob'ly turns off her autobalancer.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: Have you signed your infirmary release? Organ donation forms? Next of kin notices?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Uh... yeah. NOW Farell tweaks with the back of Cage's jacket. READOUT the faceplate FLICKER as Farell hacks into the system -  62.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: On the island of Okinawa, when the farmers were under the tyranny of the Samurai, they founded Karate on one simple principal: that the force of a blow was not in the muscle behind it but in the mind that could... let go of the body. (beat) Every muscle in the human body has a kind of control on it - something that tells it not to push too far, too fast. Keeps your body from tearing itself apart. (beat) When the Okinawans learned to let go of this control, they found that a human fist could puncture Samurai armor. And not suffer a scratch. He pulls out a chip, shuts a port. The suit momentarily WILTS. Then powers back up.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jackets have the same kind of control on ‘em. Without it, if you're not careful, you could tear yourself to shreds just by tryin' to run too fast. The faceplate readout flashes WARNING: AUTOBALANCER DISAB

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take a step. Easy. Easy. Cage STEPS, BOUNCING, clumsy. Spring-loaded.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: This is pretty cool.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: Now take a swing at that target, but I want you to - WHAM! Cage STRIKES the METAL, PYLON-SHAPED TARGET - - and sends himself FLYING across the room in the process landing in a HEAP. OW. Farell grins.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I didn't turn off the pain feedback. Just to keep things fair. When Cage gets up, he looks, the target is GONE -  63. - because it's CRUMPLED AROUND HIS FIST. A twisted fragme falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: You wouldn't want to use this on the field of battle. It's against regulation. Someone could get hurt. Farell WINKS and we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAGE is DECIMATING MIMICS, twice as fast and twice as str as he was before. He fights so fast and hard that it's a spectacle; soldiers WATCH, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: DAMN, where'd you learn to do that?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I've been doing a lot of reading. What time you got?

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: (frowning) 3:15. Cage DISPATCHES a straggler MIMIC. Leading the men up, ou the CANYON. As they near the crest of the hill - - it's started SNOWING.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: For instance, did you know that the weather is totally unpredictable? They say a butterfly flapping its wings in Australia can make enough of a difference that, on the other side of the world a month later, there might be a hurricane, all because of whether or not that butterfly was having a bad day.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: What does that have to do with anything?  64. Cage looks up at the sky, watching flakes of snow fall.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I don't know. The weather's always different.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Of course it's always different. That's, like, the whole idea of weather. They get to a CLIFF. Visibility is low. Cage motions to several GROUPS of soldiers, who all creep into position. He's organizing an AMBUSH. Cage SCANS the field below, his heads-up BINOCULAR-STYLE

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Now the mimic will be gathering right... Cage FROWNS. The vale below them is EMPTY.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's weird.

dialogues.speaker: HERE -
dialogues.text: A soldier comes BARRELING through the SNOW, HYSTERICAL.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's... IT'S A TRAP! They knew we'd be here! They were waiting for us! The soldier EXPLODES, a JAVELIN in his back.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: That's impossible, it's - - MIMIC close in from behind. YONABURU TAKES A HIT and FA off the CLIFF FACE -

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Caaaaaaage! (thump )

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Dammit. CAGE FIGHTS BACK WITH ALL HE'S GOT, a one-man army, pushi the mimic ambush back down the hill, but -  65.

dialogues.speaker: TAK TAK SPT SPT SPT -
dialogues.text: His AUTOCANNON runs out of AMMO. So does his REPEATER RIF - a FRESH SWARM OF MIMICS head this way, and - Cage JUMPS onto the turret of a HALF-EXPLODED TANK, KICKI mimic away, TEARING off the main cannon and using it as a

dialogues.speaker: BLUDGEON, WHANG
dialogues.text: He CLEANS UP on the six MIMICS, the last one running in a circle like a dying cockroach. He hits it again. It's DEA Cage looks at the twisted piece of metal in his hand. An IDEA. The smoke and blowing snow clears, and a GIGANTIC MIMIC stomps into view, towering least 30 FEET TALL.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the - It SWINGS a huge arm DOWN, all goes BLACK and we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dispensary is a mess; a tiny, poorly lit window on a world of cluttered shelves. A gaunt, prematurely balding DISPENSARY CAPTAIN watches a pornvid until -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I need an B93 external memory unit for a Beyer-Michelson exojacket.

dialogues.speaker: DISPENSARY CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: I don't think we have -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Back there, on the fifth shelf, up top. There's some that aren't in your system - Frowning, the guy goes and looks. Sure enough -

dialogues.speaker: DISPENSARY CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, but these aren't for -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I have the requisition orders here.  66. Cage slides papers across like he's done this 20 times, smiling evenly at the Captain. The guy scans, frowning.

dialogues.speaker: DISPENSARY CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: You're a Chief Engineer?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: DISPENSARY CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: What are you going to use it for?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: That's classified. Cage SIGNS. The Captain notices the number "187" written the back of Cage's hand, frowns. Cage takes the Mylar bag

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks, Roy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cage walks, keeping his head down in the light drizzle. RITA'S GLASS TOWER looms over the base like a shining nee What happens next is a SYMPHONY OF MOVEMENT AND SYNCHRONY

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sarge always said there was no such thing as chance, as luck. I still didn't believe him. Lots of things didn't seem to follow any pattern. The weather, for instance. But other things - it was weird just how predictable some things could be. Cage walks across the base like the proverbial Rabbi walk between the raindrops. He knows EVERY MOVEMENT of each pe on this base swarming with busy people rushing to and fro We flip in and out of SLOW MOTION as - - a GUARD turns and looks at a piece of paper blowing acr the road - - CAGE STEPS IN FRONT OF HIM, just out of line of vision, neatly CROSSING THROUGH A CHECKPOINT and - - STEPPING ONTO THE BACK OF A MOVING TRUCK like you'd cat carousel horse. It cruises, slows, the driver SHOUTING at SOMEONE for just long enough for Cage to STEP OFF the tru  67. - and right behind a GUARD, who he shadows, RIGHT behind and then splits off, down an alley - - past a GUY and GIRL soldier illegally NECKING - - and now skirting the base of Rita's TOWER, where severa DOG COMPANY hang out at the base, telling jokes -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'd tried to get through them twenty times before I realized I didn't have to get through them at all.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK CUT
dialogues.text: To CAGE, fighting the DOGS single-handedly, DYING in horr ways - STABBED, BEATEN, STOMPED, THROWN and DRAGGED and w

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: Cage watches from an EAVE as two of the DOGS start fighti wrestling, ANOTHER shouts for the others to come, LAUGHIN Cage uses the distraction to SLIP PAST and into -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RITA's CRIMSON EXOJACKET stands in the middle of a large WORKROOM, looking mighty, except for the LEG, which is OP pieces strewn out on the floor. SHASTA RILEY, Rita's pigtailed, overalled, Coke-bottle- glasses-wearing CHIEF ENGINEER, pores over the machinery. Shasta is so frustrated over whatever she's looking at th she doesn't realize Cage is STANDING RIGHT OVER HER. Cage winces, this part is always hard to get right -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Uh... hi there - Shasta STARTLES, jerking up so fast that her glasses fall her face. Cage catches them before they hit the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whups - there you go. He hands them back. Shasta looks at him, eyes big as sauc

dialogues.speaker: SHASTA
dialogues.text: How'd you get in here? This is... This is a classified area... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SHASTA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: only people with appropriate security clearance are allowed in -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I know. I just wanted a chance to meet the real Shasta Riley. Chief Engineer for Valkyrie One. Shasta does another double-take. She smooths out a pigtai

dialogues.speaker: SHASTA
dialogues.text: (blushing) Oh. I'm actually, uh, really behind today, I uh - Cage peers in at the exposed machinery -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Hm. Looks like the external memory unit's been damaged on that thing -

dialogues.speaker: SHASTA
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm trying to - how'd you know that?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Just guessing. You know... that is so weird, because I just happen to have one on me. Cage produces the plastic Mylar baggie. Shasta stares.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yep. That guy at the armory? The weird bald one who is always hitting on you and makes you fill out extra paperwork every time you go over there so he can spend more time totally creepin' you out? (beat) I got it off of him.

dialogues.speaker: SHASTA
dialogues.text: Oh. Wow. She looks at the dead unit she's been trying to fix -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: If you keep trying to repair that thing it's gonna take you all afternoon. A real pain in the butt. This could sure save you a lot of time - and a visit to El Creepo.  69. Cage smiles, holding the bag. Shasta eyes it, desperate.

dialogues.speaker: SHASTA
dialogues.text: What do you want for it? Cage points to the wall, where three DENTED BATTLE AXES h Shasta searches the wall, Cage couldn't possibly mean -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I want an axe. You've got extra.

dialogues.speaker: SHASTA
dialogues.text: Oh... no. You can't. I mean, that's pure tungsten carbide monomer. It's over two hundred seventy kilos. Jackets aren't made to carry a weapon that heavy, you'd overload the autobalancer -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I fight with mine off. Shasta eyes Cage up and down.

dialogues.speaker: SHASTA
dialogues.text: Oh. (beat) You're very unusual.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I'll take that as a compliment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVERYONE is suiting up, KIMMEL getting wedged into his jacket, SOLDIERS PACKING on ordinance. But Cage is REMOVI weapon after weapon, dropping them to the floor. The number 203 is written on Cage's hand.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing? Cage slips on his exojacket, looking at his bare, jackete arm, flexing, admiring it.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Lightening up. Gettin' sleek.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: What are you s'posed to fight with? A DELIVERYMAN appears with a HANDTRUCK and a BATTLE AXE -  70.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: This. Cage leans over, picks up the battle axe and we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using the HUGE BATTLE AXE, CAGE FIGHTS LIKE A BERSERKER, making short work of the mimic at hand and - - LEADING the platoon to the crest of a hill, HUNDREDS of MIMIC below. And there's SOMETHING ELSE with them -

dialogues.speaker: GRIFF
dialogues.text: Gawd-DAMN what the hell is THAT? The mimic horde parts, clearing the way for SOMETHING SO that it takes a minute to stand upright, unfolding itself

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: (eyes narrowing) That's a Megareaver. They bring 'em out sometimes. They're big, but they're slow. The MEGAREAVER stands over 30' tall, and looks like a cro between a MIMIC and a WALKING WARSHIP, GLINTING in the ra

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Crikey. LOFTING THE AXE, Cage SCREAMS, running STRAIGHT FOR IT - - the MEGAREAVER ERUPTING with javelin fire even while it raising its BLUDGEONING ARM... which SWINGS DOWN - CRASH! Cage DIVING out of its way, evading javelins, LEAP onto the Megareaver's leg, CLAMBERING UP - UNTIL HE'S ON THE THING'S BACK. It REACHES for him - CAGE CLEFTS AN ARM OFF... the stump SPRAYING the horrible blood everywhere, the blood KILLING the MIMICS it touches Then, with some persistence, Cage HACKS OFF THE HEAD. With a GURGLING ROAR, the thing COLLAPSES, disgorging wha look like UNDEVELOPED MIMICS all over the battleground. CAGE wipes his faceplate, his armor STEAMING with the thi oily black blood. He LIFTS his axe, RALLYING the soldiers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A THOUSAND SOLDIERS CHEER. From the HEADS-UP view it's obvious that THEY'VE WON THIS STAGE OF THE BATTLE. They push ONWARD, shooting stragglers -—

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (RADIO)
dialogues.text: We got unconfirmed reports that Sector Six is clear?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yes sir, it is, sir. Give us everything you got for Sector Seven.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: I'll be got-damned, son, who the hell taught you how to fight like that?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: (smiling) I know this mean old motherfucker. Showed me a few tricks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers reach a HIGH PLATEAU, OTHER PLATOONS, whole COMPANIES lining the ridge, while in front of them - - THOUSANDS of MIMIC ASSEMBLE. A FINAL SHOWDOWN?

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: What're you grinnin' about?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I never made it this far before. I'm startin' to think we might just win this thing. (to radio)

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: On your signal.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Go. Cage RUNS, LEADING THE MEN straight at the MIMIC HORDE. YONABURU by his side, Cage FIGHTS, deflecting shots aimed Yonaburu. ACROSS the PLATEAU, the SUN starts streaking through the clouds, even though it's STILL RAINING -  72. Cage dispatches mimics, the whole area around them cleari

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What time you got?

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: 4:19? Damn. Would ya look at that. BRIGHT sunlight all around them, but THICK RAINDROPS fall

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Pretty cool, huh? They say that means that the devil is... (wincing) Ow! Cage blinks. He TWITCHES. Something's WRONG. The world BLINKS OUT and BACK like a transmission getting SEVERED. Cage CRINGES - STAGGERS.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's... OW, FUCK! Cage's head. It HURTS. It's killing him.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: You OK, buddy?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Something is... ARGH! Cage falls to his knees, his BATTLE-AXE clanging to the ground. He TEARS off his faceplate, holding his head.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh no. The IMAGE SHUDDERS, the SOUND WARBLING - - and for a MILLISECOND Cage is -

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: (in the barracks) What the fuck is wrong with - Cage SPASMS again and - IS BACK ON THE BATTLEFIELD - on his KNEES.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: - fuck is wrong with you?  73. Cage's face is WRENCHED in pain, he's helpless as more MI come streaming in, taking out SOLDIERS.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry buddy, I - ARGH! Cage COLLAPSES, SPASMING, and everything goes TUNNEL-VISI

dialogues.speaker: STYLE, BUZZING, WARBLING -
dialogues.text: - WHAM! A MIMIC tackles Yonaburu, PULLING limbs off like you'd pull the legs off a fly - - CAGE lies on his back, helpless, dying, as the world BUZZES, SHUDDERS... and WINKS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cage wakes up on his bunk, holding his head. He YELLS, ENRAGED, KICKING THE WALL.

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Yonaburu scowls up.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: What the fuck is wrong with you? Cage looks around the barracks, his lip twitching. A tric of BLOOD coming out of his nose. He wipes it away.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I die at 4:19. No matter what. 4:19 is when I died the first time. A horrible, sad realization coming over him.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's just a loop. It doesn't matter what I do.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: How could I have been so stupid? I really thought I could win.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Are you OK, man? Cage walks through the barracks, steps up on a footlocker  74.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Hey! Everybody listen up! NO REACTION. Cage GRABS Kimmel's video game and SMASHES i the floor. Everyone stares. Cage clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uh, good morning. I wanted to let you know that we're all going to die tomorrow. Or at least, most of us will. I definitely will. (beat) So you should think, like really think about how you're going to spend this day. The more you prepare yourself, the harder you try to be the best soldier you can ever be, the better you're going to do tomorrow, and for that matter, the better you're probably gonna feel about whatever happens. Yonaburu covers his eyes, painfully embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to bum everyone out, but you gotta trust me on this one. This is probably your last chance to get it right. EVERYONE stares at Cage like he's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, and Sergeant Farell got out of rehab early. He's coming down the hall right now. EVERYONE flies into action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cage is eating by himself. The rest of the platoon sits a another table, talking, glancing this way, clearly talkin about him. KIMMEL steps up, looking nervous.

dialogues.speaker: KIMMEL
dialogues.text: Hey. I, uh... What you said back there meant a whole lot, man. The guy who can never fit into his suit is staring at Cag with a mixture of awe and adoration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... I was really just saying all that. Probably drank too much metacoffee. Cage sips, scowling at the taste. Kimmel sits, watching Cage pile all manner of salt, syrup and whatever on the grossest pile foods you've ever seen. It's disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gotta keep it interesting, right? 75. spicy sauce, of mixed-up Cage eats. "214" is written on the back of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: KIMMEL
dialogues.text: What's... that for?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: It's the number of times I've seen you die. (wiping his mouth) It's OK, we all do. But you usually don't even make it through the drop. The main problem is that you're too fat. They shouldn't have let you in here. But they're out of fit soldiers. Kimmel wants to get up, but it's too late -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't feel bad about it. That guy Davis over there? He won't ever make it out of the drop ship. And Roker? He ends up on fire, cooked in his own jacket. How fucked up is that? And Ford, he always manages to lose one of his arms. Sometimes the left, sometimes the right. It's the weirdest thing. (beat) Nance, on the other hand, she just totally freaks around the second hour of battle. Starts killing everyone around her until we have to take her down.

dialogues.speaker: KIMMEL
dialogues.text: Uh... I should probably go. Cage shakes his head, smiling, drinking more metacoffee.  76.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: You, you usually just drown, after you run away. (chewing) I don't think drowning's all that bad, really. Kimmel looks like he's gonna be sick..

dialogues.speaker: KIMMEL
dialogues.text: Uh... Why are you telling me this?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Because it's the one way I've figured to keep you from fighting tomorrow after that speech I gave. You're gonna get so freaked out that you're gonna take a Section Eight. The guys from the infirmary are coming in just now. You should get to know them. And in walk the INFIRMARY GUYS. Kimmel looks.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DROPSHIP
dialogues.text: Cage rides, as in the opening, but his face is grim. He O his faceplate, pulling out a flask of WHISKEY, DRINKING i the HOWLING WIND while FARELL SCREAMS at him. He offers it to the rest of the PLATOON, they shake their heads, exchanging looks, and CAGE JUMPS, whiskey FLYING -

dialogues.speaker: IN BATTLE
dialogues.text: CAGE wanders the battlefield, surrounded by the dead and dying. His RADIO is going wild. He tunes it down, until a is silence, replaced with sweeping, sad music - maybe a string quartet version of Metallica's "NOTHING ELSE MATTE

dialogues.speaker: AT A RAVINE
dialogues.text: Cage is filling a gulley full of mimics, wounding them ju enough so they can't climb out. He's clearly DRUNK. BARRELS of fuel oil dump into the ravine. The mimics are screeching to get out.  77. He lights a match to the bottle of whiskey and THROWS it, face LIT UP with the HELLISH GLOW. He looks TOTALLY INSANE.

dialogues.speaker: AT A DROPSHIP LANDING SORTIE
dialogues.text: Cage JUMPS from dropship to dropship, like Super Mario, climbing into the sky, way out over the ocean. At the hig one, he SWAN DIVES - - DOWN, DOWN INTO THE WATER. SPLASH! He turns, drifting d looking up at the dead and dying, the WAR MACHINES and MI and MEN hitting the water and floating down - Cage's PRESSURE METER going up and up until -

dialogues.speaker: ON A SHARP PEAK
dialogues.text: Cage RUNS at high speed, hauling a MIMIC up a hill, LEAPI - grabbing a STRIKEJET, HAULING the mimic bodily along, forcing the jet into a NEEDLE SHOT: straight up, ABOVE TH CLOUDS AND STORM -— - AND ABOVE THE ATMOSPHERE, where he can see the BLACK ED OF SPACE and the setting sun. The mimic ICES OVER and finally EXPLODES. Cage lets go of rocket, floating in low-earth orbit. IT'S BEAUTIFUL. His faceplate ices over, ALARMS going off. Cage opens his faceplate, THE VOID RUSHES IN, AND WE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM! A little VIDEO-GAME FIGHTER EXPLODES in a comically violent way. GAME OVER. YOUR SCORE IS 943,943,925. RESTAR Cage wanders the field of battle, playing KIMMEL'S HAND-H VIDEO GAME, paying little attention to the battle at hand Whenever a mimic comes near, Cage DISPATCHES it without e looking up from the game. FINALLY one manages to make him drop the game, Cage gets ANGRY. He throws himself into a HORDE of mimics. CAGE is a DEATH DEALER, killing without purpose, rhyme or reason, standing on a GROWING PILE of dead mimic, but MOR and MORE COME, he'll be buried soon, when -  78. WHAM, a HUGE-ASS mimic slides into several pieces as - - RITA leaps into the fray, fighting alongside Cage. Cage matches her moves, swing for swing. Cage has never fought this close to her before. RITA lands, striking a pose. Her radio CRACKLES -

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: So. It's Cage, huh? Your jacket says you're a Private. You sure don't fight like a Private.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I play a lot of video games.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: You're pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: "Pretty good"? Cage FLIES into action, killing SIX MIMIC with one comple and insane ballet-like stroke, showing off for RITA.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Your one weakness is that you fight like nothing matters. Something always matters. She demonstrates. It's like her focus is always on what's next, like she doesn't really hate the mimic one way or another - there is a beauty, efficiency in it. Cage hammers a few mimics back. Clumsy by comparison.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I've tried to fight like you. I can't.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Try. Don't think about what's next. Forget about what just happened. She swings, effortlessly dispatching more.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You fight with your eyes. You've got to fight with your heart. Cage tries. The improvement is immediate. Mimic go flying they fight together. They are a perfect team.  79. Soon, Mimic litter the field. Smoke clears. Rita smiles.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not too bad at all, private.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Well, thanks for the lesson. But I gotta go die now. Cage turns to leave. TWO MORE MIMIC head his way -

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Private Cage, I've got a question. - SLASH! SLASH! Cage FLIPS, dispatching two at once.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How many loops is this for you? Cage TURNS, STUNNED. His axe falls, clattering to the gro

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: What did you just say? He stares at her, in total shock. Rita smiles.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: I said how many - HEADS UP! A MEGAREAVER CHARGES, SWINGING its CUTTING ARM and - - the world BUZZES, falling apart, the IMAGE of Rita kill the Megareaver SHATTERING INTO FRAGMENTS as we -—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A picturesque FARMHOUSE on a hill. Waves of GRAIN shush i the morning breeze. Two HORSES nicker and prance by a bar and above, the sky is BRIGHT BLUE, hardly a cloud. RITA VRATASKI is lying on her bed, watching the sky, the horses. Rita's bed is in the middle of this wheat field. She sits up, rubbing the sleep out of her eyes. Looks lik she didn't sleep too well. With some regret, Rita taps a button and the horses FREEZ the grain STOPS WAVING. The HOLOVID IMAGE fades, revealin  80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - the UDF MILITARY BASE, the OCEAN, and operations going below and out into the distance. NOW Rita BREWS COFFEE, carefully pouring steaming water o fresh grounds, yawning, in her pyjamas. The coffee brewed, she holds her cup like it's precious, looking out at the base... until a grating BUZZER goes of

dialogues.speaker: LT. HOLSTROM, (INTERCOM)
dialogues.text: Knock knock. LT. HOLSTROM, AKA CHIEF BREEDER, enters, clipboard in han

dialogues.speaker: LT. HOLSTROM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good morning, Valkyrie One.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Hey CB. What've you got for me? Holstrom produces a HOLODISK. The room darkens, and now - STRATEGIC MAPS of the ISLAND, the BATTLE hover around the the ocean and the base still dimly visible through the gl Holstrom debriefs Rita. HILLS and TERRAIN and MIMIC CONCENTRATIONS spin and move. She takes it all in, drinki

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let me see the Sector Three ridge display again. CRAGGY PEAKS come into view, dotted with MILITARY SYMBOLS Holstrom watches Rita's face closely as she thinks. She focuses, mind going somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're probably going to hit the rear divisions. Here... and here...

dialogues.speaker: LT. HOLSTROM
dialogues.text: TAC-COM ran the simulations and see a low probability of a rear attack -

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Then tell them their simulations are wrong. (focusing) They'1l be in the mountains. Along this plateau. A lot of them... By late afternoon, they...  81. She trails off, frowning.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: After that, I'm not... getting anything else. Now Holstrom frowns, worried. BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: HOLSTROM
dialogues.text: Nothing? What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: I don't know. It's probably nothing.

dialogues.speaker: HOLSTROM
dialogues.text: What should I tell command?

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Tell them I'm taking a walk.

dialogues.speaker: HOLSTROM
dialogues.text: TAC-COM prefers it if you don't leave the tower the day before battle, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: I don't care what TAC-COM thinks.

dialogues.speaker: RITA'S
dialogues.text: except

dialogues.speaker: SHASTA
dialogues.text: memory Shasta CRIMSON EXOJACKET hangs, battered but battle-ready, for the leg, which is MESSILY OPEN - RILEY hunkers over the leg, removing the external unit, all pigtails, overalls, Coke-bottle glasses -

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Morning, Shasta. How's it going? startles, dropping her glasses.

dialogues.speaker: SHASTA
dialogues.text: OH! Hi! I, uh, we're having some trouble with the anterior memory unit on V9, but I'm sure I'll have it fixed by this afternoon, if you -

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: I just came to see if you wanted to get some breakfast.  82. Shasta smiles, always rabbit-nervous, bites her lip.

dialogues.speaker: SHASTA
dialogues.text: I'd, uh, really love to, but I... I have to get this unit fixed before tomorrow. I knew I should have just ordered a fresh one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita wanders, looking at Shasta's messy table, finding a cheap plastic figurine of... HERSELF. RITA, VALKYRIE ONE.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: SHASTA
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Just something I got off base. I, uh, think it's from New Taiwan. Rita picks up the figurine. There's a whole playset: AXE, JACKET, WEAPONRY...

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: God. The boobs are terrible! How would I ever fit in a jacket?

dialogues.speaker: SHASTA
dialogues.text: I know. It's kinda weird. I shouldn't have bought it.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: No. It's cool. It's funny. Rita puts the figurine back on the shelf. She stares up at her empty exojacket, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I... wanted to say, that, if anything happens tomorrow, that you've been a great engineer. I couldn't do what I do without you.

dialogues.speaker: SHASTA
dialogues.text: Is everything OK?

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: I'm just feel a little weird today. That's all. Worried, Shasta watches her go.  83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita walks, watching PLATOONS OF INFANTRY train. Her DOGS loose formation around her. An army photographer catches festooned with cameras, snapping pictures -

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Give us a smile, Major. Come on. Big battle tomorrow, huh? How many mimics you think you're gonna kill? But Rita's focus is elsewhere. She notices CAGE'S PLATOON fucking up an obstacle course in every conceivable way.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: What are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: HOLSTROM
dialogues.text: That's 3rd Platoon, 301st division. Conscripts. Never finished basic. They're the worst, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Everyone gotta start somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE OBSTACLE COURSE
dialogues.text: NANCE and FORD power over a wall, Nance taking the opportunity to GRAB his ass. They FALL in the mud, kickin

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: NANCE AND FORD SQUARE OFF, a throng forming -

dialogues.speaker: NANCE
dialogues.text: I think I'm gonna kill you, Fordy. Right now. Front'a everyone. They start SWINGING, just as - - RITA pushes through the HOOTING THRONG. NANCE lands a PERFECT PUNCH on FORD. He staggers, twists, and SWINGS BA Rita goes to catch his fist, but in a microsecond, notice - CAGE standing in the throng, watching HER instead of th fight. Rita hesitates... and still catches Ford's fist - - but the force of his blow THROWS them both around, his grazing her cheek just as she sends him SPRAWLING -  84. The Dogs step forward to intervene -

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Hold it, Shep. Rita wipes blood off her lip. Offers her hand to Ford.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You got a good right hook, soldier.

dialogues.speaker: NOW
dialogues.text: The soldiers hold their ISO-PUSHUPS in a perfect line. Rita walks the line of soldiers, the PHOTOGRAPHER snappin pictures from a safe distance. A few of the Dogs hunker o the straining soldiers, GRINNING EVILLY at their torture.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A jacket can't protect you from a mimic. Only your mind can. The mind is the greatest weapon you have. In the end, it is your only weapon. One of the soldiers, CAGE, keeps staring at her. His expression very serious, almost angry. Beside Cage, Yonaburu COLLAPSES, struggling to get back u

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: This man's had enough.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. FARELL
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am. Yonaburu gets up, arms trembling. DOG SOLDIERS smirk. Rit notices Cage staring up at her again. She drops into a perfect iso-pushup, right next to Cage. she looks over, Cage is looking her dead in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Is there something on my face, soldier?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: (quietly) You're a very difficult person to get to. It took me sixteen tries before I remembered how to do this one.  85.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Do I know you?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: You don't recognize me?

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: I've never seen you before in my life, soldier. Cage frowns. He didn't expect that.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you. In private. Rita frowns, noticing that "329" is written on Cage's han

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: I'll make you a deal. If you can hold the position longer than me, you can say whatever you want.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Fine. THE SUN BEATS DOWN. One by one, soldiers drop, until only Cage and Rita are left. Two DOG soldiers keep time, shaking their heads. They've never seen Rita, or anyone else, hold an iso-pushup this long. A CROWD of SOLDIERS gather, gawking. Cage and Rita STRAIN to hold the position, sweat dripping

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: You... had enough...?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I don't... think so... But Cage can't take it anymore. With a YELL, he drops. Ri Dogs WHOOP -

dialogues.speaker: CALAMITY DAWG WINS
dialogues.text: Rita gets up, dusts her hands off. Looks down at Cage -

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: It's too bad. Now I wanna know what it was you had to say. But a deal's a deal.  86. Rita turns to walk away, surrounded by her celebrating me Yonaburu comes over, helping Cage up.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Damn, that was some crazy shit, man, I never — Cage PUSHES into the throng, after Rita.

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: In a millisecond, CAGE is on the dirt, two of the DOGS on of him, his wrists behind him. Cage spits dirt.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I got an answer to your question. Three hundred twenty-nine. Rita turns, frowning.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Three hundred twenty-nine what?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Days since we met. Times I've died. Times I've woken up again. Rita's eyes go WIDE.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: What did you just say, private?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: You said it was... You called it "the loop". Rita STARES, dumbstruck.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Let him go. EVERYONE stares. Even the Dogs look perplexed. Cage gets up, dusting himself off, giving one of the violent look.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Now you mind telling me just what the hell is going on? DOGS a  87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yonaburu DRINKS, staring across the field, to where Cage Rita WALK, trailed at a distance by the DOGS.

dialogues.speaker: GRIFF
dialogues.text: Dude. What do you think they're talkin' about?

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: No freakin' idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita walks in silence, face hard as stone, until they're away from the onlookers.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: I guess you have a lot of questions. She looks at Cage's hand again. The numbers on it. Tears begin rolling down her face.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Are you, uh... OK?

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Yeah. I just thought I was the only one it had ever happened to.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Are you... in the loop with me?

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: No. I got out.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: There's a way out? Rita looks out through the fence at the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: It was in the Battle of Florida. I'd lied about my age when I joined up. I didn't know the first thing about being a soldier.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BATTLE OF FLORIDA, JACKETED INFANTRY FIGHT MIMIC B
dialogues.text: THE THOUSAND. We fly over the battle, finding - - RITA'S PLATOON. She's clearly way too young to be here, keeping close to her Captain, LT. ARTHUR HENDRICKS, a goo looking, fatherly man in his late 30s -

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We didn't have a chance in hell, but I was lucky, my Lieutenant was looking out for me. He kept me alive while everyone else in my Platoon got shredded. They FIGHT side by side - - but then LT. HENDRICKS goes DOWN, KILLED by a mimic wit

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He died, trying to save me. I lost my head and went after the mimic that killed him. The YOUNG RITA HUNTS DOWN the MIMIC, enabled by REVENGE a FURY alone. Her EXOJACKET is TORN HALF AWAY when she fina KILLS the thing, using her PILEDRIVER -—

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I killed it. And then I died. - SHE DIES, in the QUICKSILVER BLOOD of the ANTENNA MIMIC see the image fall apart, then RITA WAKES UP - IN HER BARRACKS, screaming, in her hammock. People STARE.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I woke up the day before the battle had even started. I thought I'd gone crazy. RITA wanders the barracks like a ghost -

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I must have died twenty times before I pulled myself together and decided to stand and fight. ON THE BATTLEFIELD, RITA HAMMERS mimics with a REPEATER RIFLE, SNARLING as she is CUT DOWN in a SPRAY OF RED -  89.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: After a while, I got better. We see LT. HENDRICKS die a VARIETY of DEATHS, RITA WEEPIN over some of them, FIGHTING through the rest.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was in four hundred eleven battles before I figured out how to break out of the loop. ON THE FIELD OF BATTLE, Rita now fights with a BATTLEAXE - when she sees a RAINBOW MIMIC, the first one she killed just like the one Cage killed, streaking across the field Her eyes NARROW, she RUNS AFTER IT and we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAGE'S FACE, desperate to know -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: The first time you died. Tell me exactly what happened.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I'd been hit. You were there. You took my battery. This... big mimic came up. Kinda... rainbow colored. It was going to shoot you in back. I killed it. It bled on me. I died. (beat) It was, uh, pretty awful.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Do you remember what it was doing, when it... when you died?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: (frowning) Yeah. This... stuff was coming of it, like little wires. I've never seen one of them do that.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: You killed an Antenna. While it was broadcasting. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When you killed that mimic, you got tangled up in the signal. Became a receiver. Just like I did.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I... what? Rita smiles.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: It's probably easier if I show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SINGLE JACKETED HUMAN fights a MIMIC, we pull BACK, to SPY-SAT AERIAL VIEW of a BATTLE in PROGRESS. THOUSANDS of MIMIC flood across a field, engaging with THOUSANDS OF HUMANS, but we pull FARTHER BACK -

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: You ever wonder why the mimic almost always know where we're going to strike next? - until all that we can see are hundreds of thousands of and RED DOTS converging, dissolving, repeating, almost li mathematical equation, on abstracted, 3-D terrain. Rita's face is dimly illuminated in the holobay.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look. BLUE DOTS head to a position... But RED DOTS get there fi

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you see the pattern?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Let me speed it up. NOW the battle scuds by at high speed, the mimics POUR on the human defense forces, like SAND settling, shifting -

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Watch the movements.  gl. And a pattern emerges: ONE SMALL CHANGE, then... EVERYTHI flows in a new direction. Pulsing from RANDOM ACTION... t FOCUSED ORDER.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now. Slow it down on that point. She scuds back and forth across a SHIFT, ZOOMING in...

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The shift happens... each time an Antenna gets killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .--we zoom in to see a single MIMIC, getting killed by a single SOLDIER. But at that moment, the whole mimic strat like grains of sand at the wider zoom - abruptly SHIFTS.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When an Antenna dies, it sends out a message. To the receivers. One RED DOT winks out. But the BLUE dot finds itself surrounded... TRAPPED.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But the message travels backwards. Into the past. Nine red dots CONVERGE. The blue dot is EXTINGUISHED. The action REWINDS... the BLUE DOT moving back from the R DOT, until earlier, several RED DOTS move from their coho

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's a perfect strategy when you think about it. You don't have to outsmart an enemy if you always know what they're going to do next. Nine red dots CONVERGE. Again, the blue dot is EXTINGUISH

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: So... when I killed the Antenna and it bled on me... I became a receiver? And now I'm picking up messages from...

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: ..-yourself, thirty-six hours from now. Like memories, but of the future. Every possible future will play out, until you break the loop.  92.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: We have to find the Antenna you killed. The one that bled on you. Before you killed it. Before it sent the broadcast.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: And kill it?

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: We have to get the receivers too, or it won't work at all. But yeah. That's the idea. Cage nods, his head swimming.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: That's it? That sounds almost easy.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: It's not. They'll know we're coming. They'll do whatever they need to kill you every time. (beat) They know how important you are. Cage frowns.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: If you break the loop, the mimic won't be able to tell what happens next. (beat) You'll be able to win the battle. Cage's eyes go wide. Rita smiles. On the holovid, STREAMS and EDDIES of MIMIC overpower hum forces, over and over, in a constant loop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STARS are bright above, as Cage and Rita walk across base. The DOGS trail behind them, keeping their distance.  93.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I can't believe I'm really going to be free tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: (smiling) You'll still be in the UDF. ACROSS THE ROAD, OFFICERS enjoy final drinks at the PX. C can see the tail end of his PLATOON, sneaking around back

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yeah, but no more headaches, no more loop. I'll get my life back. Rita's expression goes distant.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Yeah. But I should warn you. I think being in the loop... did something to me. Sometimes I still pick up... fragments. Feelings, little things, the day before a battle. Like I can pretty much tell if someone's going to die. (beat) It's why I don't really talk to anyone the day before battle. They come to a crossroad; Rita's tower is one way, C-Comp barracks, the other.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You should get your sleep. It's going to be a pretty big day.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I was wondering - your lieutenant, the one who helped you. Were you ever able to save him? A terrible sadness crosses Rita's face.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: No. (beat) I think there are some people you can't save, no matter what. Rita turns and walks away. From the shadows, a couple Dogs give Private Cage the las their suspicious looks and fall in line behind her.  94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yonaburu is slumped on the floor, drunk. Cage stares at Yonaburu, thinking about what Rita said.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Well, here he is Mr. Bigshot talking to the Valkyrie all day. She tell you how we're gonna win this thing?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think she did.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Good. Semper Fi, motherfuckers. Cage helps him up, Yonaburu mumbling, clutching his girlfriend's picture. It falls to the floor. Cage picks it up, looks at it. Thinking. Knowing he'll be free tomorrow. Knowing Yonaburu never will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dropship ROARS, STRAINING against the headwinds. DOG SOLDIERS & C-COMPANY stare at each other, while OUTSIDE - RITA AND CAGE CLING TO THE HULL. Rita pointing to the CLI teeming with MIMIC INFANTRY -

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (RADIO)
dialogues.text: There. Do you see ‘em? The receivers, they're always a few rows back. You can tell by the movements. NINE RED DOTS on Cage's heads-up converge and divide.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (RADIO)
dialogues.text: I see ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Let's go. They JUMP. The DOGS follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIMICS swarm the field, coming by LAND, SEA and AIR.  95. We slip between EXTREME CLOSE-UPS OF ACTION, of Cage and Rita's faces, to WIDE STRATEGIC VIEWS of battle, RED and flags dancing and spinning in the heads-ups.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: There's a receiver. Flag it.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Got it. FIGHTING SOLDIERS STARE as Cage and Rita fight together, mobilizing the troops, JUMPING past ranks. Even Rita's DOGS can't keep up with them.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: And another. You see it?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yeah. As a team, they are UNSTOPPABLE. They complement each oth like perfect halves of a single fighting machine.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: You're pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: You keep saying that. Their eyes meet. Smiling. They DIVE in, Cage showing off Rita. They're DRIVING the mimic back, performing moves we never seen before. It's BEAUTIFUL, watching them fight.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's two more. Cage and Rita fight like two people in love. The CLOUDS a starting to break, the SUN moving at high speed through t sky as the BATTLE PROGRESSES, CANYONS clear, MOUNTAINS cl - we find Cage and Rita again, at the forefront of SQUADS victorious SOLDIERS engaging the MIMIC in groups -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think I see the Antenna. There. Three left, protecting something - A LARGE, SHINY MIMIC breaks cover, STREAKING through the RAIN, to the CLIFF where Cage died the first time.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: We're almost out of time.  96.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: We'll move fast. The last three RECEIVERS converge to protect the ANTENNA.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've got these. Go for the lead. CAGE begins fighting the last RECEIVERS as - Rita LANDS in front of the ANTENNA MIMIC, its iridescent, rainbow-slick armor glistening in the AFTERNOON SUN. It pauses... and then RUNS. Rita CHASES, the thing deflec blows right and left. It's DAMN GOOD. FASTER than the res Every time Rita lets up, TINY BLACK TENDRILS exude from t mimic's armor. It's trying to BROADCAST -— Cage HAMMERS the last receivers, dodging and weaving, hac down ONE, then ANOTHER, while RITA and the ANTENNA FIGHT - it suddenly PUNCHES back, sending RITA FLYING, then JUM landing right over her.

dialogues.speaker: ONE MORE -
dialogues.text: Cage SPINS IN AIR, twisting down as the final RECEIVER fi multiple javelins, everything goes SLOW as his body moves just the right configuration to evade every one - - then he BRINGS his axe down. The last receiver is DEAD.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All clear. He sees the ANTENNA standing over RITA, tendrils waving - - and with a BATTLE CRY, Cage HURLS himself at the thing, in a blur of ARMOR, AXE and MIMIC - Cage stands in low battle stance. The ANTENNA MIMIC slides into six pieces. The pieces fizz crackling. Cage steps away from the boiling blood. It's over. Rita gets up.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm free. I'm really free.  97.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: We still have to go win this thing. Cage opens his faceplate, Rita opens hers, feeling the ra Cage suddenly KISSES Rita. And then... she kisses him bac harder. BLUE SKY opens behind them, like her famous poste

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know what they used to call this? When it's raining and the sun is shining?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yeah. You once told me. You said it's because the devil was beating his... OW. The weird BUZZ, the image SHUDDERS. Cage BLINKS, staggers, a SHARP PAIN in his skull.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Are you OK?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I, uh... there's something - BEHIND RITA, along the ridge, MIMIC LAUNCHERS begin to li the cliffs. Thousands of them. Behind Cage, too.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO
dialogues.text: «+.GOT MASSIVE BUILDUP HERE... NEVER SEEN THIS BEFORE... TRAP... Cage turns. MIMIC are surrounding them, more arriving eve second. Rita's face falls.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Something's wrong, I... AIGH! A terrible PAIN stabs through Cage's head. He twitches, stumbles. He looks at Rita, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Cage?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I'm still in the loop. Cage SCREAMS IN PAIN as the IMAGE SHIFTS, FUTZES to -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - having a SEIZURE, people STARING, blurry, WINKING OUT a

dialogues.speaker: CAGE IS BACK ON THE BATTLEFIELD -
dialogues.text: Rita's face buzzing back into view, only now she's CRYING cradling Cage's twitching body as he dies -

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Cage! CAGE!

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I... I don't think it worked. Cage's nose is bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: I know. I'll stay with you. ALARMS are going off in her jacket, MORE and MORE MIMIC a surrounding the spot, by land and by air.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: You have to... get out of here... Rita shakes her head. Their eyes meet. She's crying.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Rita, I - But it's lost in a hail of MIMIC JAVELINS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cage opens his eyes. Yonaburu cleans Mrs. Smith. Making sure to get every cham really into it, proud of his work, until he notices - Cage, staring at the poster of RITA, tears on his face.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: What the hell is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: It didn't work. We did everything right, but it didn't work.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Cage picks up a sharpie and writes 393 on his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yobo, I got a question. If you had to spend the rest of your life living the same day over and over again, forever, what would you do?

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: That's a weird fucking question, man. I dunno. Probably see my girl. Live happily ever after 'n stuff.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: That's a pretty damn good idea.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: (frowning) Did you just call me "Yobo"? Cage smiles, and we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita's glass tower glints in the morning light. The DOGS are assembled around the base of Rita's tower, having just finished breakfast. TWO of them are SCUFFLING for fun, while the others egg them on. One of them - picking his teeth with a bowie knife - look up, noticing - - CAGE, walking this way. HIGH-NOON STYLE.

dialogues.speaker: HEELER
dialogues.text: You ain't got the clearance to be in here, kid.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I need to see Sergeant-Major Vrataski, now, and you need to get out of my way. The scufflers get up, eyeing Cage.

dialogues.speaker: HEELER
dialogues.text: This a joke? 'Cos you 'bout to be in a world a' - Cage moves. WHAM! HEELER goes DOWN -

dialogues.speaker: SHEP
dialogues.text: What the -  100. Cage TEARS into the Dogs like a MAN POSSESSED, fighting t ALL AT ONCE, eyes steady on the door to Rita's tower. The Dogs have been in battle 20, 30 times. Cage, almost 4 Even without his jacket, Cage is pretty much unstoppable. IN SECONDS, all the Dogs are on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cage walks in, dusty, wiping blood off his lip, looking around. An EXECUTIVE OFFICER frowns up at him, and - - Rita comes out of nowhere, SWINGING.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: But Rita ATTACKS, hyperfast. Cage can barely deflect her blows. She sends him CRASHING down, Cage spins, fights ba - but he's no match for her. In seconds, she's on top of hand on windpipe, fist cocked and ready to kill -

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you? The DOGS rush in, ready for bear -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: (gagging, bleeding) Don't. I'm... in the loop. I killed an Antenna. I'm like you. Rita...

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: My name's Billy Cage. I... I'm in the loop. You're... helping me. Rita sees... that 393 is written on Cage's hand. Rita's EYES GO WIDE - She lets go, jumping back like she touched a live wire. C starts COUGHING. The DOGS stare, totally confused. HOLSTROM walks in, cocking his gun, leveled at Cage.

dialogues.speaker: LT. HOLSTROM
dialogues.text: Anyone wanna tell me just what the hell is going on here?  101. Cage slowly salutes, at attention.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Private... William Cage requests permission to speak with Sergeant- Major Vrataski. In private. Rita nods. Holstrom hesitates. Stands down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk, Rita's mind racing, and tears on her face. The highly confused Dogs trailing well behind.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: (wiping her eyes) Sorry. I'm just... used to being alone.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: How'd you... figure it out?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I didn't. You told me. Last time. Before I died. Rita nods, wiping her nose.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: We have to find the Antenna you killed. And the receivers. I can show you how.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: You already did. She stops, looking him in the eye, suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Then why are you... here? Cage hesitates. He can't tell her the truth.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Because, uh... at the last minute, I didn't kill the Antenna. We... wanted to come back. Spend the day together, just one more time.  102.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Oh. I see. Rita eyes Cage, wondering just what she and this Private been doing, in his past, in her future.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: You, uh, wanna get some breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3rd PLATOON is in the Cafeteria, grimacing over the chow.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: I don't know! He was crying, then he just jumped up and took off like a bat outta hell. And whatever he said to the Sarge musta - (seeing) Sweet Jesus on a mountain. Cage and Rita enter the mess hall together, followed by t Dogs, who look just as confused as everyone else.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE AND RITA STAND IN LINE
dialogues.text: The SERVERS try not to stare at them, lumping chow.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I'm sure not gonna miss the food. Rita doesn't know what to say. She looks nervous, like sh on her first date.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Table in the corner. Just like always. They sit.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: This is weird. I feel like you must know everything about me.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Not really. I mostly know how to kill mimics. I'm pretty good at that. You said so yourself. Rita smiles uncomfortably. They eat.  103.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One thing I could never figure was - why do you come eat with us? No one in their right mind would eat this crap if they didn't have to.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: I have to do something that makes me feel like myself. I kinda got used to it. Cage pours chocolate sauce over a pile of pickled eggs.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: This is my favorite lately. "Pickled egg chocolate surprise". Cage digs in. Rita tries some. She smiles. Not bad.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Loop food. Brings back memories. What about... Rita piles hot sauce on top of her oatmeal, adding what l like canned sardines. Cage winces. She offers. He tries i

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Not bad. Kinda... Smoky. Everyone is staring at them. Cage takes another bite, was it down with a big swig of metacoffee. Rita winces.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: How do you drink that stuff?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Hasn't killed me yet. Their eyes meet. Rita suddenly starts laughing. Cage too. the anxious worry coming off of them. Now everyone is REA staring. Cage leans in -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You wanna get out of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUMORS visibly SPREAD around base, SOLDIERS going out of their way to stare at the pair as they walk, the DOGS beh

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Follow me.  104. Cage takes Rita's hand PULLS her around a corner, RUNNING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - down an alley, losing the Dogs, finding... THE HOLE IN FENCE, right where Palka always makes it.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GULLS CAW, waves CRASH on the shore. Rita and Cage walk, stealing glances at each other. A sweet tension between t

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: So when we, uh, decided to not kill the Antenna, and come back, were we, like...

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: We, uh, just kissed. It all happened pretty fast. Rita pushes her hair back. No one's around.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: I want to know what it was like.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Uh, OK. They kiss. Nervous and tender. It's possible that Rita's never kissed anyone before in her adult life.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: That was... nice.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: It was weird, too.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess it must be. Rita looks out at the ocean, feeling complicated.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Why'd you join up?  105.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I got drafted. I tried everything I could to get out of it. And now... here I am. (beat) The last time... you told me you lied about your age to get in. Why?

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: I was sixteen. A farm girl. The town I grew up in, mimic scouts came up river, some hunters found them. They burned my town. I lost everything - my dad, my mom. My horse. (beat) I guess I joined the marines because I didn't want to live anymore. I figured if I could kill just one mimic, that would be enough and then I could die. I don't know what I was thinking. But I was lucky. There was this man. Lieutenant Arthur Hendricks. He found me. Showed me how to use my jacket.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Were you... in love with him? A painful look crosses her face.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, you just seem... really sad about it.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: It's OK. Yeah. I'm pretty sure I was in love with him.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Rita trains with ARTHUR HENDRICKS. He's handsome, late-30 warmth in him, not undone by the years of battle. Then he's showing her pictures of his WIFE and CHILD. She looks at him like a girl in love.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I think he loved me too. But he had a family, so it was different... we never even talked about it. And besides, there was a war on.  106. WE SEE HER WINNING THE FINAL BATTLE, soldiers CHEERING in smoke while she WEEPS over the body of ARTHUR HENDRICKS -

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No matter how I played it, I could never save him. He was the real hero of that battle. He died, and I got a medal. No one ever knew. - and then, ON A STAGE, getting the Valkyrie Medal of Hon draped around her neck. It means nothing to her.

dialogues.speaker: WE CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: Rita, sitting in the sand, the same expression on her fac She wipes away a tear.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When I finally got out of the loop, all I wanted was to get back in. To have one more chance to save him. (beat) I'd have traded the whole battle for it. Cage looks at her, not sure what to say.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I'm... really sorry. I think maybe some people are just fated.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Maybe so. She looks at Cage.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Would you kiss me again?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yeah. They lie back. On the distant shore, the low THUMP and GL of ARTILLERY hammering the far-off island, and we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cage opens his eyes. The morning sky is bright blue overh He's in Rita's bed. And her bed - - appears to be in a WHEAT FIELD. Cage sits up, disorient  107.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Pennsylvania. The farm where I grew up. We had the bluest skies you've ever seen. (beat) It's just an old holovid. But I wanted you to see it.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: It's really beautiful. Rita smiles, a little sadly, and gets up, in her pyjamas. The holovid FREEZES, distorts and fades, replaced by - - the thick polycarbonate glass of Rita's tower. Cage stares out at the island, the distant shelling, preparations for today's battle in progress, far below. A grinder WHIRS, water BOILS, GROUNDS go into a brewing p

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: It's coffee. Real coffee. Some of the last in the world. She adds water, the dark brew drizzles into the pot.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I thought that stuff was extinct.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Almost. There's an island off the coast of Africa - one of the last places it'll grow. I fought there once and they still have it flown in for me. It doesn't seem right that I should have it all to myself. She pours some into his cup. Cage drinks. His eyes go wid

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: That's uh... nothing like the stuff they have in the mess hall.  108.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: It's probably the best cup of coffee you can get in the whole world. I mean, since no one gets to make coffee anymore. You have to do it just right or it's no good.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: You'll have to show me how sometime.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: (sadly) I'd like that. Rita looks down at her coffee.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was wondering. The last time we... were in the loop. You said we decided not to kill the Antenna?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Uh, no. But don't worry. We'll get out this time. She searches his face. She knows he's lying.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Well. I'm glad we decided to come back.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Me too. They kiss, holding each other. Cage looks out at the beautiful vista, smiling... but something is flying this WHAM! A MIMIC JAVELIN HITS THE TOWER. ANOTHER VOLLEY STREAKS IN - WHAM! WHAM! Cage and Rita are THROWN to the floor, her tower SHUDDERING with the impact The polycarbonate fractures, spider-thin cracks working t way across the room - but it HOLDS. Cage picks himself off the floor, stunned. ALARMS start going off. BELOW THEM, the BASE is getting HAMMERED by MIMIC JAVELINS - - SOLDIERS run like ants on an upended mound as MIMIC ERU beneath them, the beaches DARK with MIMIC crawling from t SEA - CARRIERS and DROPSHIPS engulfed in flame -  109.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: The mimic are attacking early. They know we're together. (beat) We have to get out of here. Another JAVELIN hits the tower, pieces SHATTERING IN. Rit GRABS Cage and they PILE into the elevator, the tower SHUDDERING with multiple impacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They make it out, and to the ENGINEERING BAY. SHASTA is already there, with Rita's crimson exojacket ready -

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: (to Cage) We have to find the Antenna. We're not gonna get another chance. Can you make it to the armory?

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I think so. Their eyes meet. Shasta notices the LOOK, and Cage TAKES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOTAL MAYHEM. SGT. FARELL SCREAMS at 3rd Platoon as JAVEL TEAR HOLES in the roof of the locker room. SOME SOLDIERS make it to their jackets in time. SOME DON' YONABURU finds his jacket, but - WHAM! An EXPLOSION sends flying. He picks himself up, arm bleeding profusely - - his exojacket is WASTED. Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: ELSEWHERE, CAGE
dialogues.text: Runs through the disintegrating locker room, DIVING, JUMP through the carnage. He gets to his locker - it's DESTROY HIS FACE: All is lost.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Yonaburu, spattered in blood and dust, holds Cage's jacke

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They got mine. But I saved yours.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Thanks, buddy. You're the best.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Go get ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cage RUNS across the base, his heads-up a USELESS MESS of blue and red, the base in CHAOS -

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (RADIO)
dialogues.text: Right here. THOOM! Rita lands, the DOGS with her. HUNDREDS OF MIMIC CONVERGING on this ONE SPOT. But Rita fights with TWO AXE cutting a SWATH - - and then THROWS an AXE to CAGE, he catches it just in t SWINGING just as the MIMIC reach him. SHUCK! The mimics F

dialogues.speaker: AND THE BATTLE IS ON
dialogues.text: HOLSTROM calls in STRIKEJETS. Rita SEIZES EXECUTIVE COMMA organizing the remaining HUMAN FORCES. Cage LEADS PLATOON Cornered, against impossible odds, EVERYONE fights at the best - better than their best. - FORD saves NANCE'S ASS, the two TEAMING UP - - the DOGS lay WASTE to everything in their path. SHEP is crushed. HEELER is blown in half. INU throws himself on a exploding MIMIC to save FOX. DANE ignites an AMMO DUMP, killing a hundred MIMIC at once - - SGT. FARELL finds himself fighting one-on-one. Just how likes it, WHANGING mimic with a twisted piece of metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - KIMMEL even commandeers a DROPSHIP, FLYING it into the HALL, DIVING and ROLLING FREE and watching the explosion.

dialogues.speaker: FROM ABOVE
dialogues.text: STRIKEJETS hail holy hell on the ADVANCING MIMIC FORCES, the BASE is half-destroyed. It's not looking good.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE AND RITA
dialogues.text: fight their way onto a HEAP of smoking metal, getting a V of the war-torn base.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: There. And there. Do you see them? NINE RED DOTS are flagged WHITE.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Nine of ‘em, check.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: We don't have much time. Cage kills a RECEIVER - WHAM. RITA kills ANOTHER - WHAM. Their moves in perfect mirror images of each other. ONE, TWO, THREE mimic receivers go down. Everyone goes do different way. Each one is harder to kill than the last. The ANTENNA always WATCHING, RETREATING, HIDING - The last two receivers TAKE FLIGHT, Cage and Rita HUNT th down, merciless and unstoppable, finding themselves in -

dialogues.speaker: THE SMOLDERING CRATER OF THE MESS HALL
