dialogues.text: The RAINBOW-COLORED ANTENNA MIMIC SCUTTLING into the WRECKAGE. Rita HEAVES back a hunk of smoking DROPSHIP - - the ANTENNA MIMIC LEAPS, knocking her back, and is ON C in a FLASH. CAGE FIGHTS BACK, but this mimic knows his ev move. A SCREECHING BLUR of LIMBS and JAVELINS firing. Cage is KNOCKED BACK, WHAM! WHAM! BLOOD hits the inside o his PLATE as he GOES DOWN - As the blood beads and trickles off, Cage looks up at the spinning BARREL of the mimic's JAVELIN ARM. It's going to kill him now. WHACK! Rita hits it from the side. The ANTENNA flies thro the air in SLOW MOTION, tendrils FLARING -  112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOUSANDS OF MIMIC STOP ATTACKING. SOLDIERS are left scratching their heads as mimic DETACH, racing across the base to ONE POINT: to the MESS HALL CRATER -

dialogues.speaker: BACK WITH CAGE AND RITA
dialogues.text: - where the Antenna LANDS and LAUNCHES ITSELF at RITA, th BLOWS KEEPING THEM BOTH AIRBORNE until - It KICKS RITA'S FACEPLATE, SHATTERING IT. She SCREAMS, lo grip on her axe - RITA FALLS TO THE GROUND. The AXE falling nearby. JAVELIN pepper the area until a HUNK OF DROPSHIP FALLS ACROSS HER

dialogues.speaker: LEG, PINNING HER TO THE GROUND -
dialogues.text: The MIMIC LANDS, standing over her, VIBRATING with POWER - its JAVELIN ARM leveled at Rita's unprotected face. She glares up at it, gritting her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: DO IT, YOU BASTARD.
dialogues.text: An ELECTRICAL ARC ZAPS between the mimic and Rita, then t Antenna mimic... CHITTERS, the WHIRRING stops. Then it BACKS AWAY, looking for Cage -

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: - the MIMIC whirls, too late. WHAM! Cage's AXE swings, CU into the mimic, BLACK BLOOD FLYING, but it's not DEEP ENO The MIMIC SCREECHES, fighting back in a BLUR, but Cage BL its every strike. With no other option, the mimic starts SHUDDER, a tachyon charge building - - Cage SWINGS and the MIMIC falls, CRACKLING, SHORTING OU DEAD. Cage is on his knees, exhausted. ALARMS going off in Cage heads-up. THOUSANDS of mimic will be here any second. He goes to RITA, opening his faceplate.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Are you OK?  113.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Get this thing off of me. Cage STRAINS, lifting the fallen piece of dropship and freeing her, helping her up.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks. They KISS, urgently. The SUN is streaking down, RAIN, too

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: We don't have much time. You have to get out of here. Killing the Antenna... it doesn't work. We already tried it. I don't know why, but they're still coming. I don't think there's any way out for me. MIMIC have begun to line the rim of the crater. MORE arri every second.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I... I'm sorry I lied. I just wanted to be with you. It was the only way I knew how. (beat) I love you, Rita. Rita picks up her axe.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: I love you, too. Rita SWINGS, hitting Cage with the flat of the axe - KNOC CAGE BACK 20 YARDS. He sits up, holding his jaw.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: What the hell was that for?

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: I figured it out this morning. She walks towards Cage. He scrambles back. She looks up at the crater rim, her heads-up thick with o rushing mimic coming from every angle.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's me. They're using me.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: What?  114.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Whatever the loop did to me, it turned me into a receiver. She SWINGS her axe, Cage ROLLS -

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As long as I'm alive, your loop won't end. Cage GRABS his AXE, DEFLECTING HER BLOW, backing away.

dialogues.speaker: RITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have to kill me. Or you'll never be free.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Are you out of your mind?

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: I'm the last receiver. Rita HAMMERS Cage. Cage PARRIES, backing away.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I can't... I'm not gonna fight you.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Then you'll have to loop again until you get it through your thick skull. It's you they're after. You win the battle. Not me.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: I've watched you fight. I've seen what you can do. Cage KICKS her away. The edge of the crater is lined with MIMIC - but they don't attack - they wait.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna kill - AIGH! Cage staggers. His head. The image SHIFTS, BUZZING, like going to LOOP again. He YELLS, the world comes BACK -

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: It's the only way out.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: No, I won't -  115.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: You have to. But Rita gives him everything she's got. She's SWINGING a him, FORCING him to protect himself. Cage DEFLECTS blows best he can, BACKING, ROLLING AWAY. But Rita LEAPS — - and with a YELL, Cage RAISES HIS AXE, WARDING HER OFF,

dialogues.speaker: MISSES A PARRY AND -
dialogues.text: - Cage's axe slices into Rita. She FALLS. Badly injured.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: He throws his axe down. Runs to her. She pushes herself u over on her back. Blood gushing out of a gash in her side Cage cradles her.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: You'll be... free now.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I can get you help. We can get out of this together - Rita shakes her head, coughs, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Dying's not that bad, once you get used to it.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Rita! The image DISTORTS, SPUTTERS one last time - and is NORMA The rain is coming down. The sun is shining. Cage stands, picking up Rita's axe, wiping his face. He l at the MIMIC HORDE. He raises the axe and RUNS into the h with a BATTLE CRY.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Rita was right. About everything. We see Cage's HEADS-UP, blinking RED, but as he fights we the onrushing FRONTS of mimic FRACTURE, EDDY as -

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FIELD OF BATTLE
dialogues.text: SOLDIERS UNDER ATTACK watch as SOME MIMIC start running i the wrong direction, OTHERS even start attacking each oth  116.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: At first a few stopped working right. But pretty soon, they just fell apart. Farell watches as everywhere the mimic fall into CHAOS. S still attack, but the synchronous VOLLEYS, the ORDERED FR LINES are gone... From ordered WAVES, to SWARMS, to NOISE... The SKY is a HELLISH RED as CAGE CLEANS UP. The look in h eyes - insane with grief, exhaustion. He doesn't stop.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I kept fighting long after the battle was over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the EARLY MORNING LIGHT, the BASE is smoking, ruined. staggers through the wreckage. YONABURU and SEVERAL OFFIC trail Cage at a distance, afraid to come close. Cage's exojacket is blackened, dented. Cage finally drops axe, with a CLANG, and FALLS to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I don't even remember when they found me. PRELAP: TAPS begins to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FUNERAL PROCESSION stretches out across the base. A MIL SOLDIERS watch, and PEOPLE across the WORLD watch as RITA FUNERAL BIER is marched across the ISLAND. ON A VAST STAGE, surrounded by COLONELS and MAJORS of eve stripe, Cage is awarded the Valkyrie Medal of Honor. The second person in history to receive this privilege.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We'd won the battle of Ruby Tuesday. I was a hero. Cage looks like the saddest person in the whole world.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But it didn't matter. Nothing did. Rita was gone.  117.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BASE is still ruined, but full of living HUMANS diggi out, making repairs. BANDAGED SOLDIERS watch NEWSCASTS ab the BATTLE OF RUBY TUESDAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cage's EXOJACKET stands in the center of a workshop. YONABURU, his ARM IN A SLING, is painting Cage's jacket BRIGHT BLUE, like you'd detail a car. He stands back, admiring his work. Cage steps in.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I like it.

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: I don't know, man. You're gonna make a pretty easy target. I was thinking we could put some flames on there -

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: No. I like the blue. (beat) I brought you something. Cage tosses Yonaburu his new medal. Yonaburu frowns.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (smiling) There's your gold star. Keep it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cage rides the elevator up into Rita's broken tower. He h to step past warning tape to get to her room. The spilled coffee. The bed just how they left it. He stands there, looking out at the clear blue sky. There's a knock. It's Shasta Riley. She salutes. Cage nod

dialogues.speaker: SHASTA
dialogues.text: Uh... hi there. They said you were up here again.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Hi Shasta.  118.

dialogues.speaker: SHASTA
dialogues.text: The morning of the battle, when Rita got her jacket, she, uh, wanted me to... to give you this. In case anything happened. She hands him an envelope. Cage frowns.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: SHASTA
dialogues.text: I miss her so much.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: I do too. She nods and exits. Cage opens the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: LETTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: How to make the best cup of coffee in the world: Handwritten instructions. At the bottom of the instructio

dialogues.speaker: LETTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I love you. Always fight with your heart.

dialogues.speaker: NOW
dialogues.text: Cage is pouring the boiling water over the grounds, follo the instructions. Cage drinks the coffee, staring out at the base. Distant ALARMS start going off. Cage frowns. Yonaburu com in, out of breath, he RAN here -

dialogues.speaker: YONABURU
dialogues.text: Cage. I thought I'd find you here. Alaska's under attack. We gotta move out. Cage nods, puts the coffee down. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CAGE
dialogues.text: Right. Let's go win this thing. THE END.
